mqjwPAFYvLqXcXEPsGSUAA.text: Sea Level NC has a large, open floor plan with both indoor and outdoor seating. It is modern and clean. The wait staff is very friendly and caters well to specific requests. I haven't had any issues with lines or wait times, simply directed towards a vacant table upon arrival. The seafood is fresh and of great quality. Their dishes are portioned well at a medium to large size. I recommend ordering a plate of their Fat Baby oysters, they're silky and huge. This is the perfect place to fill up on delicious seafood!

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

4bbP-9AlFn8HceKyA3xl2A.text: Wonderful small plates. I ordered an oyster taco and a shrimp taco with a side of house fries. All very delicious but the oyster taco would have to be my favorite. It was one of the best tacos I've had in a while.

gA-MMtTw5YLwcmf9OSKNag.text: Came here on a Saturday night a few weeks ago. Made a reservation (which is a must) since it was packed and we still had to wait about 20-30 minutes for a table. The food is amazing though!! Ordered the oysters Noda (a favorite), two types of oysters, Maine mussels (another favorite), corn fritters, duck tacos and vegetable of the day. Oh and can't forget dessert- cinnamon pot du creme. Service was a bit slow and I think that our waitress forgot about us for a while. Noisy atmosphere. But... if you are looking for a lively place for dinner with great oysters and mussels this is the place to go.

sisVRp9ExWU0hBsJMgSkew.text: A few girlfriends and I dined here for restaurant week. We had reservations so upon arrival we were greeted and seated almost immediately. The place is big, considering it's uptown and in the Hearst Tower. They offer to comp your parking as long as you park in the tower so bring your garage ticket with you. If you ever been to the Lobster Place in Chelsea Market in NYC that's what this place reminded me of. Lots of table room and space. We had different servers throughout our meal so that was a little bit confusing. Foods came out prompt and everyone seemed to have enjoyed their meal. Every course was filling and perfectly cooked and seasoned. Overall we thought this place was great and definitely worth coming back to, especially for the $1 oysters happy hour during the week.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half Dozen Sea Level Oysters
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. NC Catfish a la Plancha
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

7EzxAqkGEUizkzdOdqof3A.text: The service was amazing, the food very high quality but the flavors were way off. Too much anise in the pork belly slider!! Will have to come back to try more items. This place looks great, really love the ambiance.

W0pbON7xT-qabBnDWbStXA.text: Had a great dinner here last night while visiting Charlotte. Food was excellence and the service was fast and attentive. Paella was delish.

F06_pufpXwPmrhdB_AAtJA.text: Service was excellent! The menu is short because they focus on bringing food from farm and sea to table. So keep in mind that the menu will change frequently. Fresh food and fast service!

nvjgdkK2TUoPECkNITxCnw.text: Sea level was fantastic I am happy hour oysters were fantastic from South Carolina which was on a big surprise I typically get them from up north.the wait staff was fantastic and Andrew took care of us at the bar area we actually sat At the oyster bar area areso we could watch them as we were waiting for our meals the corn fritters were absolutely delightful

0-AE-tTr0QpzTB8Wkm8YzQ.text: Loved It! Ordered fried fish & oyster tacos & the oyster stew. Nice place for a night out. I am glad we finally have a fresh seafood place in uptown! I liked their craft cocktails. Will definitely come back!

KvTTh0CaAs7jwjIYkgHUyg.text: I was craving some seafood and I also knew after consuming said sea food I wanted to get a  drink at one of my favorite bars in Charlotte, Connoly's. Well, Sea Level is right next door so this was a winning combo for a date night. We got there after 7 pm which meant no partaking of the 4/7 pm Monday through Saturday happy hour where oysters (I'm sure not all varieties) are $1. Still ok though. I was with my husband and we started with cocktails; I got a dirty Tito's martini that hit the spot and my husband got a krampus. I selected one each of the kumamoto and rappahannock oysters. They set me back 2.75 each which I don't mind paying for since they are quality oysters and soon waters will be getting to warm for oysters so getting them all in while I can! We shared the corn fritters which were disappointing as they were more hush puppy than corn but they were good, just not what I expect in a corn fritter. They were also round-ish like a hush puppy and not pancake-ish in shape like a fritter. Just a bit misleading. For dinner I got the lobster roll which was great and on a buttered, grilled roll. I paired that with a house salad. My guy picked off the sides menu and created a dinner of the fish taco, duck taco and pork belly steam bun. The fish taco and bun were his favorites.  I like this place and the staff was on point as well.

dcfbwuiBnORWmzHGh1UHkw.text: Nailed the fish tacos!  I ordered the duck salad, without the duck.. nailed that, too!  Next up, Catfish.  I mentioned to the server that I was avoiding fried food, so she offered it grilled.  This place has a modern atmosphere and menu.  This will be my Charlotte go-to spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch Menu

elN3wglbsAsZuJyCpHadLA.text: I've been here a couple of times and the seafood is always great and they have a good selection of wines by the glass.

gWYiydUQN1LXhjVod4cmQg.text: Food was decent. Nothing spectacular. Oyster shooter and Spanish g&t was good. Decent wine selection. Our waiter ended up being very friendly. For the price - you can do much better in CLT.   BUT. The host and hostess were horrid.   First - I called on Friday and tried to make a reservation. I was told they don't 'do' reservations. Ok. That's odd. It's a nice restaurants - I expected reservations - but again was told they don't 'do' reservations.   What they meant was they were booked full.   That is 2 VERY different things.  So, we went on Saturday. Walked in and - yep - were asked for our reservation. But wait... I was told yesterday - you don't 'do' reservations. Blah blah blah, (uncaring and general blah) - was the response from the hostess.   We were directed to a 'first-come-first-serve' area - it worked - two stools at a communal table.   Neither host bothered to bring us a menu or utensils. Then, sitting in the 'you didn't have a reservation - even though you called' section, I watched a host play on his phone all night.   As we got up to leave - he surely wasn't bothered to open the door for my mother who was visiting.   Excellent service starts at the first interaction. Excellence was, for sure, lacking with the first and last 'touch'.

3SBGQmRIVyaZ1ouH-uQtzQ.text: Delicious dinner before the baseball game. Lobster roll was full of perfectly cooked lobster and had just the right amount of dressing.

yvQ1GdjSwFnclieAB3E9nw.text: This was my first time at this place & it was everything people bragged about. The food was DELICIOUS  & the oysters was nothing less than the entree! We had a waiter name NATE & HE was PROFESSIONAL, KNOWLEDGEABLE & PLEASANT. His customer service was top notch & we made sure his tip reflected it!! If u love oysters, come during happy hour 4-7 & the sea levels are $1. They also I recommend this place!

fdDakj_uQW9IHxWhQGHJdw.text: Expertly crafted farm to table seafood prepared by people who really know what seafood should taste like. From the first call we made to see if they had a table to the final course of the night the service was exceptional. Our server could not have done a finer  job helping us navigate their menu. She offered honest and intelligent insight into every question we asked about their various dishes.  The oysters were fresh and delicious. The flounder awesome. The restaurant menu was quite well laid out with something for everybody even though strange creatures who go to a seafood restaurant and want a hamburger. LOL  I always love a seafood restaurant that doesn't have everything on the menu all the time. It's a great sign that they're buying really fresh fish all the time. There's a reason why special dishes are special dishes and it's not because they've bought something mediocre in bulk. This place got it and got it right from the oysters that started our meal to the Keylime ice cream that ended it with everything in between perfect!  If you haven't been here yet you need to get here now. Enjoy!

VpfLPzKBsdKaEYfDIM3XAQ.text: My first visit to Sea Level rendered great appetizer, great dinner, and great dessert.  Let me tell you, the wine was even better.  What I loved was that our waitress was well versed in the wine selections (she was taught to appreciate wine at a prior gig; she is studying to become a lawyer).  They purchase fresh ingredients on a daily basis and build the day's menu based on those ingredients.  That said, you don't know what you might find upon entering the restaurant.  My visit was a little while ago;  I don't recall exactly what I had to eat, but I definitely recall that the experience was absolutely fabulous and I can't wait to go back!

cNox3Y7tGV69e9MhcKyJhQ.text: We visited Sea Level NC Saturday night for a friend's birthday celebration. Our first issue was our table wasn't available until 15 minutes after our reservation time. When we inquired about the reason for this, the host immediately "got an attitude" and was very rude. They proceeded to sit us in an area where several of our members were cold, when we asked to be moved, again we were greeted with an attitude.   We were waiting for a few others in our party to arrive, so we inquired about shots. Our server couldn't accurately advise which liquor was in the various shots she recommended. There were a few in our party that wanted to order shots of 1800 tequila. They were disappointed to find the bar didn't have it in stock.  Our final complaint was our waitress was very slow. We had to wait 10 minutes to receive water, had to wait 5-10 minutes for her to appear after each of our additional party members arrived (the restaurant was half empty so there was no excuse for this), and 15 minutes for her to bring the check at the end. The food was just "okay" in my opinion (but I've lived in Houston, Maryland, and Louisiana and am used to "great" seafood so the lack of great customer service and a fully stocked bar, in addition to mediocre food, are the reasons I won't return nor recommend this establishment.

WbKT-093CPm416YXU5nw2A.text: Good food, especially the fried oyster salad, Good decor, outstanding service. A lively vibe but noisy.   ]

xBRgvwAKqzzqFdFk_bmvOw.text: Sea level was good. Best shrimp and grits we have had outside of our own home hands down. The catfish Ruben was also very good. The service was alright. I made a reservation because I read elsewhere that it was recommended (even for lunch) and it was not all that busy but it still took 10-15 minutes to get our drinks. We definitely will come back and try brunch or their $1.00 oysters from 10pm-12am or even dinner. The restaurant itself was very unique and we enjoyed the setting. I'm looking forward to giving them a second chance.

oU6jbfBpsMVp1t2rbNt8Ag.text: I really like this place. I love oysters, and they have many options. I love seafood, and they have fresh, seasonal, and local options. I like interesting cocktails and enjoyable wines and they have all of that. Fun atmosphere and good customer service. Highly recommend.

BkwelOfmhsonODFhVe9Bkg.text: This place has been on my bucket list since it opened and it did not disappoint! The fiance made a reservation for 7:30 on a Friday night, but we were surprised to find that we didn't even need it. There were a good number of tables available but the place had a good energy. We chose to sit outside since it was a nice evening.   Our server came over after we had just a few moments with the menu and we both ordered cocktails. I had the meow mule and my fiance ordered the smoked old fashioned. I really like the mule cause it was light, not too sugary, and decently boozy.   Since this is one of the few True seafood places in Charlotte, we ordered the Snapper and the Trigger fish dishes, planning to switch halfway through the meal. The trigger had a nice crablike taste to it, which our waiter explained is because they eat  crustaceans. It came with a yummy sauce and rice. The snapper had crispy skin, was buttery, and came over a wonderful succotash.   Prices are a little higher than I'd like to pay for the average dinner out, but it's good quality and nice for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meow mule and smoked old fashioned

EhJsazGNt-uCzztWSb0xig.text: We were a party of four with a noon reservation on a Saturday in advance of a show at Belk.  There were only a few patrons when we arrived.   The server was ok but not great.   We ordered two lobster sandwiches, a shrimp po boy and a catfish Reuben.  The wives liked the lobster and the po boy was ok but the bread was not crusty as you would expect....the catfish Reuben was very salty and wet on the bottom.  I specifically asked the waiter about the Reuben before ordering and he said it was great and would not be wet....wrong.   All in all it was a $87 lunch and we were not impressed.   We will not go back....overpriced and under delivered.

ak0bj2k5LIJFuAcyTFm_Tg.text: The level of service here was a breath of fresh air. Chris T was accommodating, quick, and incredibly polite. The manager came out to let us know that one of our party member's food was over-prepared, and they purchased their dinner as well as desserts for the entire table. The food itself was unbelievable! Lobster bisque is a must if you like a little kick. Excellent service and food!

RRJ93m4Tu9FkIfXHRSzIyg.text: Food was delicious if a bit delayed.  Staff was knowledgeable and helpful without being too present during the meal.  Seafood was well presented and better than expected inland.  Intimate setting.  Not suited for larger parties.

H9y5kMGk__h-L8bJv2CbcQ.text: Restaurant was clean. Staff friendly. The lobster rolls were good although not the best I have ever had. We had one of each to compare. My personal opinion is that it was a bit over priced for what you got and the fries had a ton of salt on them. They do validate parking which is pretty awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

Z577GvXng0bE1LWIlNKN_g.text: I decided to try Sea Level again after a few months and to order some different items and give them a chance.  I had a really great experience second time around and am happy to report I will be back again.  This last time left me wanting more!  I started with the fish taco, Sea Level oysters ($1: 4P-7P), and the ghost pepper pommarita.  The taco only came with one (I wish more) but was delicious!!  I definitely recommend getting a few of these as a meal. Very good.  The oysters were phenomenal and very large.  The were served with horseradish, cocktail, and a mignonette (which I never had in my life). I can't wait to have these again!! The pommarita was right up my alley:spicy and a touch of sweet, I enjoyed it more than I thought I would.   For dinner (as if I didn't eat enough already) I chose the Tile fish with corn gazpacho, tomatillos, and duck fat potatoes. YUM!!! The potatoes were extra crispy and the gazpacho added a hint of sweet to the dish.  I literally want this again right as I type.  The tile fish was mild and crispy.   To finish I had the blueberry cheesecake shooter.  It was rich and delightful.  Nathan was our server, he made the second chance experience outstanding.  He was really nice and patient.  I thank him for taking really good care of us.   It's all about what you choose on the menu, and the first time I just chose all wrong. Read reviews, look at pictures and ask for Nathan.  He recommended some things and was spot on with his descriptions.  I'm glad that I went back and will be back some more.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish taco
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ghost Pepper Pom
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oysters!!

bGMvR77xMagt6wAdb0K0_Q.text: This is one of my top seafood restaurants, the food is amazing, and the prices are not expensive at all. The atmosphere is too die for, as it is in the middle of downtown. We ordered a variety of options from the menu and wasn't disappointed in anything that we ordered. Definitely a great place to eat. You won't be disappointed. The lobster roll is my favorite. You can get it Maine style or Connecticut style.

YRJeY20f5ad4d9UDFKOilw.text: Good wholesome and filling meal at a good price.  I was here for work during the beginning of the CIAA tournaments and I met up with some frat for drinks and dinner.  After walking around down Charlotte (my fault) looking for the restaurant I finally found it.  Very nice spot on 5th with a great feel to it.  There's a nice bar and the ambiance to the place.  I sat down with the guys and joined in. All of their appetizers looked delicious.  I ordered a crown and coke and for my dinner I had shrimp and grits with a nice gravy on it. It came out quick and hot. Delicious meal! I'd definitely order it again along with the meals my frat brothers ordered as well.  The only thing that was bad was the service. Our service was too nice. I wish I had her name But she did too good a job making sure we had drinks and food in a timely fashion. I mean the nerve of her. All I know is if I remember to come back to ask for her.  This is a nice restaurant and it's someplace I'd come back to. Until next time...

4oDI-mSphLrIDtMWeHM5xw.text: Calimari is amazing just wish they would give you more pieces order seemed very short. Lobster roll and fries are amazing. Can't really go wrong with sea level. Beers are pretty cheap also.

E1hYdMjAZJDIOJoPFNDUCA.text: Went back to try this place because my husband liked it the 1st time. He order the same food (shrimp-po boy) and thought it was just a good as the 1st time he tried it. This time I ordered the salmon (which I was asked how I wanted it ...) Waiter suggested to let the chef choose how to serve it. I must say that I was skeptical that it was served over sweet potatoes (I do not care for) but let me tell you! When I took a bite of my food! I made umm and omg noises the whole time I ate it. My food was so good and so was the hubby. The salmon was juicy and flavorful, I even liked the sweet potatoes.Staff are always super friendly and nice. They also asked if we needed our parking ticket valet. I will def go back to try the paella next time. Love the atmosphere

Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled salmon
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussels and oysters taco

i6TYXQM_7bFZRIRfUmEuWg.text: Redo - to do something again or differently.   Hey Sea Level. It's me. Let's try this again.   My second visit was absolutely amazing! The service was good and the drinks were good and the food was delicious.   I started with the fish taco app and it's so tasty. Super fresh and well seasoned. I could eat a a few of these!   To drink I tried the ghost pepper pomegranate pommarita. It was just the right amount of spicy blended with the pomegranate mix and it was spot on! I'd absolutely recommend!   For dinner I had the salmon with crispy potatoes and a house salad. My salmon was cooked perfectly! Nice and tender and the addition of the aioli was such a nice touch of flavor! The potatoes were crispy and well seasoned and the maple ginger dressing is homemade and awesome.   Our waiter Nathan was kind and informative and very attentive! He's so knowledgeable about the menu don't be afraid to ask him questions!  I'm completely putting the first visit out of my mind. This time I was won over and I'm looking forward to another visit!

Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato Cake
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon

rLNHICbkkE7DU4kYVVwzXA.text: 5 stars for the owner contact via Yelp. 5 stars for the goal service and trying to ensure customers are met with satisfaction.  4 stars for not presenting info that the HEARST parking deck is free for lunch or dinner. I was worried it was only for dinner and drove by it twice.  4 stars for the french fry that was so hard it cut my molar gum area where the wisdom tooth is located and was extracted back in 1997. Yeah... how do I know it happened. I kept feeling a tingle and once I tried putting a tad of ketchup on another fry and that salt got into the OPEN wound..... whew doggie!   That's what I get for eating while driving.   Anywhoo, I'm ecstatic that you can get the Connecticut - True NE style - solely butter by asking the morning before they open. They set aside enough lobster that I thought it was generous and so did a colleague. I'll try the chowder and maybe a slider but honey~~~   I will get to brunch and have a LOBSTER ROLL with only butter SANS mayo over the weekend.  I'm glad they are open for the weekend nowadays with Brunch offerings.   Also, the little bookmark with upcoming events placed in my bag is super cute. They are hosting events 1st Mondays for the next four months.   Oh, a few rude customers  Sweet security/sheriff guy working the parking deck.  Preferred Parking has some good people working here as I misplaced my parking ticket and they got it all straighten out.  Inside the building the security staff was pleasant in escorting me to the garage entry so I wouldn't walk up the exit.  Recap: Don't miss the toasted Lobster roll as the bread is the right style and right about of toasting. The lobster is NOT langostino. This is real sweet meat lobster. It's $19/per lobster roll.  Comes with a side of handcut fries. Next time I'll seek out what the substitutions are NOT because the fries are lacking but because I want to try other things.   I called before picking up and it was ready immediately after I paid so I'm happy they were prompt.

7c1VubH_41YuWH_uJ7rrWA.text: I hope this goes more as a review than a tip because it is  gonna be pretty short. I loved the place and the overall vibe of it...the food not so much. So the drinks were phenomenal, the muscles were very bland and the fried shrimp was greasy, and my fried oysters were ok. I tried something new and was happy about that. The Sheepshead Fish(which I never heard of) was delicious. It was medium in size and very filling. The awesome part of this restaurant was our Server, Nathan. He was so fun and knowledgeable and very honest about the menu. Will I go back?!!! Yes because again, the atmosphere is great and the drinks were perfect. Guess this wasn't short after all!!!

nptiIgmwhnbByB_rbKWCaA.text: Had been really looking forward to dining here. We arrived for brunch to celebrate the early-alcohol bill (better than before but still a bit backward at this day and age...) and the waiter wasn't aware of the time change, plus the actual alcohol selection was limited. I tried both the brunch cocktails and they were refreshing, but actually a little light on the booze.   The seafood paella was individually portioned which surprised me as I never see this dish available in small quantities. When it came out, it made sense, though. It was a tad bit undercooked in spots. The seafood was delish and the chorizo wasn't as bad an addition as I feared. They also were able to custom-add a poached egg or two on request. This almost made up for the undercooked bits.   The corn fritters appetizer wasn't anything special and I wished I had more options for a spread (savory and sweet butters would have been ideal). Probably wouldn't bother with that again, to conserve my calories and tummy space for more worthy options. Only one in three of the daily dessert shooters were good--the local peaches which actually tasted/felt like apples. The mocha mousse and lemon curd were ... unpleasant. Truly. Good crust base, though.  My understanding is those flavors change regularly so no telling if you'll have a similar or completely different experience. Gamble at your own risk. It was a fun and shareable crapshoot, at least, and we giggled quite a bit at how truly astringent the lemon curd was.   The server was friendly and made my companions feel just right, which I appreciated, but he was new to the restaurant and you could tell he just wasn't that familiar with the menu, the kitchen, and the policies. As the face of the place, this alone loses a full star for me.   Would I return? Yes. Would I order the seafood paella again? Yes. Will that be soon? No, I think I'll make the rounds and collect some other brunch touch points first.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood paella for three--plus a poached egg. Good amount of seafood but a tad undercooked. Chorizo surprisingly subtle.
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Only one in three of the daily dessert shooters were good--the peaches which actually tasted/felt like apples. The others ... unpleasant.

GScgBKeoJkjhgZPKSNJLgg.text: The lobster roll was delicious and I highly recommend the fritters.  I will give the service a little benefit of the doubt because it was busy but multiple people in my party received their dish with the incorrect side or cooked how they asked.  The Manager did try to make it right by bringing us free dessert.

2uaknBuufOcrCMG-VDeoHw.text: Out of all the seafood restaurants in Charlotte (surprisingly few), our experience at Sea Level has been the best so far.  We had a 9pm reservation and they were running 15 minutes behind on getting us a table. With neither request nor hesitation, the hostess stated she would have the manager speak with us.  We were not expecting manager involvement over such a small delay, so it was a very pleasant surprise when she came to our table to offer a very sincere apology.  Additionally, 2 other staff members apologized for the wait, as well.  Throughout the entire evening, we observed excellent customer service.  No less than 4 staff members visited our table to bring food or take dishes away, showing a very strong teamwork policy.  The food was also very good. From the crab chowder to the squid chow chow to the shrimp & grits, everything was excellent.  All four of us commented on how good everything was. The environment was upscale but not stuffy. The whole experience was wonderful and we will certainly be back.

RV8I6OaM5XNlqjodFN3b7w.text: I had a great experience here! I walked in at 415 pm, and the Happy Hour was $1 sea level oysters between 4-7 and 10-12. The place was just becoming busy for happy hour and I'm glad I got there early.  My server was jovial and knowledgeable about the menu. The sea level oysters were delicious, slightly briny and small/medium in size. There was a selection of over 10 different oysters, a wide variety across the US and decently priced.   The host was friendly, the bartender was knowledgeable about the menu, and the oyster shucker gave me some great places to check out in town.  I'd say the clam chowder was pretty darn delicious and I'd recommend it.   There was a patio section outside which was pretty spacious and butted up to one of the main roads, or plenty of seating at the bar or in the dining space.  I'll be coming back here.

ktAbFHUsrEpladGpctpiog.text: I legit think this is one of the most underrated restaurants in Charlotte.  From the friendly staff to the casual, but upscale environment, I'm always impressed with their menu and specials.  Sure, they run out of things, but that is to be expected when things are f-r-e-s-h not frozen.  I see that you can make reservations via yelp, I wish that they would get on the OpenTable Bandwagon.  Strong cocktail menu to boot and wine list isn't too shabby, either.

kvWMLyrIwxHg2DmV6K8rmg.text: Great service and attentive management especially when we mentioned the smaller than expected ceviche portion which was comped. The shrimp steam bun and fried oyster taco were excellent. Great catfish entree made for an enjoyable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cerviche

DcwPL0ETsje2cY7KtkbwlQ.text: Enjoyed some oysters at the bar while we waited for our table. They have oysters from 10 different places from which to choose. Once we were seated, we started with tempura shrimp and corn fritters. The shrimp was incredible and a healthy portion for a starter. The corn fritters were fried perfectly and the dipping sauce was delicious. We ordered snapper that was cooked perfectly and a daily special. The salmon was also very good. A lively atmosphere and great food.

Jd8qUgPsB9FcZbdfc1LtHw.text: Great to see restaurant packed on a Tuesday night. Bar area was over stuffed at 6pm. Dinner was good - Not amazing but grilled Salmon never is  - left a little still hungry actually.  Food came out fast and servers were all very nice. Great atmosphere.

VI_9f_8bcVbJEL8XCCzewQ.text: Adding to THE LIST! I was looking for charbroiled oysters coming from a trip to New Orleans and saw this restaurant had an impressive oyster menu. So I decided to stop in for an early dinner.  Located in a bit of a hidden spot in Uptown, right off of Tryon, with an entrance on 5th Street. I was immediately seated and the restaurant was still a little light at the time. My server Joe was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and very professional, but still friendly. No charbroiled oysters, so I tried the Oysters Noda. For my meal I had the catfish Ruben and substituted the fries for the braises greens.   The Oysters Noda were good. The bacon was a bit overpowering, but still good. The catfish Ruben was PHENOMENAL! The seasoned, grilled catfish, cheese and mix of flavors in the "slaw" were excellent. I even really like the flavor of the greens.   I will be back to try the fritters, shrimp steamed bun, lobster roll and fried catfish with grits.

WKrJLJ2Sgq-dUacfJdCloQ.text: Holy cow! If you love seafood run don't walk to this place! Seafood Tower with the Sea Level oysters that are being grown just for this restaurant was amazing. The oysters had a sweetness and a briny quality  and a freshness which was truly unique and absolutely delicious. How fortunate is Charlotte to have this place! Can't wait to come back!

OeJu0QUBl8EKntS2I1ycpg.text: Heard a good bit about this restaurant before visiting and I can't say that the hype lived up to the realization of what I experienced. Not a very busy day and I didn't get my wine until the very end of my last bite. The food was regular. Nothing exquisite or over the top in any way. Haven't been back since that first time and probably won't be returning either.

q8xzte54GKp-DczZwMu8Vg.text: We had dinner here before going to the theater. It was a terrific dining experience! Our server and all of the wait staff were extremely nice and gave us top-notch personable service.   My husband and I couldn't choose between the shrimp po boy or lobster roll, so we ordered each and requested that each be cut in half so that we could share. Not only were they cut in half, but they split them and our sides on two plates for us! (Both were great...the lobster roll and corn fritters were my fave...the po boy and fries were my husband's faves.)  We ended our dinner with a white chocolate berry shooter dessert which was delicious and made from scratch in-house. Perfect touch to an already fab meal!

1ZlytUlq0wclFFXEcU1CjA.text: I was craving seafood and this place was on point. I had the fried oyster tacos, fish tacos and the lobster roll (CT style) and it as all fantastic. Then when it couldn't get any better I had the key lime ice cream sandwiches. I'm a crazy dessert animal and it met all expectations.

THMUpY70IhV67QyfXBD30g.text: It was clear straight away that this is THE hip seafood joint in Charlotte. The service was great. Our server, Nate, was very prompt and helpful. Everyone in our party of ten was extremely impressed with all of the dishes we tried.

gKVRJhpehAboInVOGQPOMA.text: Excellent food, fresh fish, local fair, and decent prices.  It was confusing about happy hour oysters.  So ask in advance-we ordered and then learned from the tab.  All in all great evening.

uH-7vlZ4x8fVNK0aZpwzbA.text: Became one of my favorites in Charlotte. Went for anniversary dinner Saturday night. Hard to find good seafood since I lived in Miami the majority of my life. Love the industrial, semi-casual decor/atmosphere. Nice they take reservations. Server was fantastic! Food was delicious and good portions. I'm tired of the newer restaurants with the mini portions they serve. These were just right. Not too big and not too small. Had stone crab appetizer which was one of the specials of the day and the ceviche. Both really good. Husband had snapper linguine which was prepared perfectly! I had clam chowder and ceasar salad.  Will defiantly  be revisiting!

dl6d9S9POuHu_jr1UdzSSw.text: We came here for seafood and had a good calamari chow chow and corn fritters to start. The chow chow was good but the corn fritters didn't have much corn taste at all. Our waitress was not the fastest and we waited a while for my husbands beer.  I got the shrimp and grits- 6 shrimp and a bit on the salty side. This could have been nice but the service was lacking.

yDxgG5d0RXwL20HyaAjUnQ.text: I love the outdoor seating here and the atmosphere is really relaxing. The duck taco is delicious, mostly sweet with some spice. The shrimp bun was very good as well. I never thought about a shrimp patty and may try it at home! Great choice all around. The food portions were just enough. Oh, and the hurricane punch (half of the proceeds go to victims of the recent hurricanes) was very delicious as well. Nate was my server and he is pretty awesome with lots of energy!

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hurricane punch (with 3 rums)
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp steam bun and duck taco!

O3YizlUSmS3D55i1cjvRMQ.text: Previous review posted out of irrational and misplaced anger. Much respect to Mike for reaching out, hopefully Jade doesn't get hold of my Yelp app again.

r13vmpBF_YjoP2cQMC0_Sw.text: My father and I came here, both from out of town and let me tell you..... the baked oysters were to die for, dirty martinis were on point and someone even hand stuffed my olives with blue cheese for me. We had the Salmon linguine and it was enough for us to split. Joe was our server and he is top notch! He has some of the best customer service skills. He never let our drinks get low and was always there when a plate needed to be picked up. He made the experience very nice. We will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

bcuE_sXH3h-L-1gDy2WtAQ.text: Stopped by for lunch and was not disappointed. I started with a glass of wine - y'all know I love wine lol. The waitress suggested the Carletto Pinot Grigio. It was reasonably priced at $8/glass - nice crisp flavor with fruity hints. I ordered 4 oysters, which were priced individually, and also the pick 3, which was 2 small plates and a side. I chose 2 "Sweet Jesus" oysters from ME and 2 Blue Point oysters from MD. Both were fresh and tasty. No overly fishy or salty taste to them. For the pick 3, I chose the oyster slider, the fish taco, and the corn fritters. The oyster slider was a fried oyster with a slaw mix and a jalapeno cream drizzle. It was the bomb.com. The fish taco was amaze balls too. The fish was seasoned really well, and they didn't skimp on it either lol. The corn fritters were equally delicious - nice mix of sweetness and heat from the dipping sauce. Overall, it was a really great meal. I did however wish that the oysters came out first instead of all together. It did seem to take awhile for everything to come out - I started snacking on the stale crackers that they bring out with the hot sauce and moist towelettes lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pick 3 lunch: Oyster Slider, Fish taco, and corn fritters. So good!
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Jesus and Blue Point oysters

L1qNyfULw0RfY0g8aAUa9w.text: Wow- service was so bad we didn't even make it to ordering. The hostess was rude, never gave us menus. We had to ask our server to bring them to us and then he disappeared never to return. Well we shall never return also.  Will say the manager did offer his apologies on the way out, I could tell that level of service was unacceptable to him.

PDOnkDJl5g_I-TI2ayjrpA.text: Visiting from New York. Have to say this place was amazing! Food was great and staff were some of the nicest people we've met. We had a party of 11 for lunch and had a little bit of everything we could (soup, oysters, sandwiches, tacos, shrimp/grits, dessert) . Couldn't find a bad bite if you tried to. If we are ever in North Carolina, first meal will be had here.

oUsJJOhHuZ9lTcldukA2sA.text: Family came from out of town, went to Levine museum, great place to visit. Went to sea level around 5pm. Not busy and seated quickly. Slow for a waited. Four of us ordered lobster rolls & greens, we didn't know there was an up charge for the greens but we didn't get any sides and we were suppose to get one side. Waiter brought our drinks then we didn't see him for quite some time. Finally another waiter brought our lobster rolls although very small, on a small hot dog roll was good along with the greens. Waiter came by, fill water and walked away. Came back later, ask if we wanted desert, came back with the bill. I flagged him down and asked about the up charges and he immediately asked did I want a manager. Manager took one off and charged half for the others. Lobster rolls are $24, although we're good not worth it . First time here, poor service, expensive small portions. Maybe just a poorly trained waiter made this a very bad experience.

WyMHBXoZdXqJ2EGEUeRYYg.text: Oyster Taco and the Catfish Po' Boy are a must both very good, nice attentive staff at the bar area

svP98j__1lCB5U-QB0nIOQ.text: Fantastic atmosphere and even better food!  Expect more of a tapas experience, than a meat and potato meal.  Lot's of  fun!!

opgyWbeQjqrbebeke-q66A.text: I had the absolute best experience here. Our waiter worked with us to create the perfect meal and continued to check in after every round. I've never had a restaurant personalize their set menu like Sea Level did.

hLLlCmteymNplwHLrqozig.text: Great seafood.  I was very impressed by the food here.  They had a great selection of oysters and a number of delicious preparations of local fish.  The craft cocktails were we thought out and creative.  A great spot to have a nice piece of fish.

RypLeXTfyJ0X-WLndhyLDg.text: I had a fantastic fish dish. I had the golden tile. I had never heard of that type of fish. It is a light white fish. The fish was perfectly cooked and served over rice and crispy vegetables. The spice was unusual and outstanding. I was blown away by the great taste.  The service was great. The atmosphere was quaint and relaxing. The prices are high, but it is worth the price. This was one of my favorite fish experiences in years.

z2ONst1PtMGhdB7e7Y35-w.text: Stopped in when I was in Charlotte for one day. We sat at the bar for a drink before dinner and wound up staying at the bar for food. John the bartender was great, very personable and quirky at the same time. The food was excellent as well. We had a dozen of the happy hour $1 sea level oysters and then had another dozen. The oil sauce and vinegar pepper sauce were so good on the oysters and they come in cute little bottles. We had the fish tartar (I forget the name of the fish) and calabash shrimp both good dishes from the nightly seasonal menu. For drinks we started with a bottle of white. After watching John make so may interesting drinks we decided we had to try some. Smoked old fashion for me & a Hot dirty martini for my guest. WOW they were good. For dessert we opted for a couple of bloody maria shots (bloody mary shot with a raw oyster in it). All in all, a really fun experience, mostly due to John who we thoroughly enjoyed watching and learning and the witty conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

aItphYIdYnunpEUZKv8hZA.text: GREAT oysters! Love the selection. Service was great, as well. The mignonette red wine sauce is AMAZING!!

PN0GE93fzJoC0r-PC7o8vw.text: Went with 3 stars, but would've gone with 2.5 if half stars were a thing. Visited Charlotte from out of town and we were really looking forward to this spot. The vibe is really cool - very farm-to-table, dimly lit, a hipster's paradise. Service was great but the food didn't hit it out of the park...maybe a base hit at best. We started with a dozen raw local oysters and the grouper ceviche. The Sea Level oysters were TINY...like barely there, shouldn't have been served kind of tiny. The restaurant touts that these oysters are brought in daily, and to that I'd say maybe daily isn't the way to go...let those puppies grow a few more days. I don't even know if that's how it works but just saying, if that's what you're naming your restaurant after, I would've hoped for a more impressive showing. The ceviche was good but a more apt name would've been jicama ceviche as there was far more of that than grouper. For entrees, the wife got the salmon with a side of grits and I got the NC paella. The salmon was cooked to order at a medium and the grits were extremely tasty (very balanced flavors and great texture), but the spiced chutney was way too spicy. The paella was served in a skillet, which automatically earns it a bonus point. who doesn't love a skillet presentation?? the protein to rice proportion was appropriate but overall the dish was on the dry side and didn't wow on the flavor front. So, all in all, everything was edible and nothing was terrible so there's that.

kj7ZsKI2NkAiAhCMaJbQjQ.text: We ate here for Queens Feast and were incredibly pleased with the atmosphere, menu selections, and cocktails. The swordfish was perfection with the zoodles and lobster sauce. I ordered the ribs plate and it was SO MUCH FOOD!  The meat fell straight off the bone and the potato salad was the best I've ever had. We had a dozen and a half oysters and the variety was great. My favorite dessert was the mint chocolate chip ice cream cake. The seasonal G&T was absolutely incredible. We were so pleased and will definitely be back.

ATuxl8Q31Wcgcbj4_3AJPA.text: If you like seafood, then you will love Sea Level NC. They have a casual atmosphere and very friendly staff. They have a lot of options for the sailor type, but not too much for the land lover. Give them a try the next time you are in Charlotte.

BUKdWKkzdOM5M5xBq61opw.text: The staff is gorgeous!  I love the spicy horseradish aioli sauce that comes with the fried oysters!  The housemade Mignonette sauce is a must try if you are a fan of the local oyster happy hour special!  The House Punch is a great drink for two to share or a smoky old fashion if you're a bourbon fan.

SJW5MIq-C7hgtj4b-kr5mg.text: Great service, they serve good quality oysters and the paella is phenomenal! It came in the pan with generous helpings of shell fish and the crispy fragrant rice at the bottom of the pan was the BOMB! I'd definitely come again!

P7bD_WNAsYTtbCBxueY-yg.text: Had an awesome lunch here. My meal was really delicious I got the Catfish Ruben. I suggest getting no mayo or no coleslaw unless you really like coleslaw. The corn fritters taste exactly like African puff puff, I tasted no corn but they were yummy. The restaurant is in an office building and it was very relaxed around 2pm. Most stars going to service because the hostess was amazing I went in during lunch and she went above and beyond even giving me an umbrella so I wouldn't have to walk in the rain or take an Uber to go down the street. Much appreciated. Highly recommend trying this restaurant during lunchtime.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cat Fish Reuben

fKI4VHaWosR9BBPwfJK2fg.text: Went to Sea Level with a work group.  We were not from the area and relied on previous reviews.  The majority of us ordered the lobster bisque which is the worst I've ever tasted to be honest.  The soup was more like a puree the same consistency as baby food with the tiniest bit of lobster as a garnish in the middle.  I shared the seafood paella and a lobster roll with a coworker.  Both were okay, not great.  The lobster roll was small and the lobster itself was over cooked.  The paella was very dry.  The rice stuck to the bottom of the dish and the mussels were very dry from being under a food heater I presume.  The server threw a tantrum when we asked for the alcohol to be separated from our food orders and proceeded to scold us for not asking the moment we sat down.  You press buttons on a computer screen.  Your life is not that difficult.  Relax.

ZWm25pw68jeyfMk5WS9jVQ.text: I just left Sea Level and I must say my experience was less than desirable. We arrived to the restaurant around 3 pm and I was so excited because the yelp reviews for this place looked really great. My friend and I ordered the fish punch which was really too lemony if you ask me. After disappearing for 15 minutes the server comes up to us and tells us they are not serving any food other than the raw bar and walked away. Then a nice server comes up to us 5 minutes later to check on us and inform us that he's now our server. WHATS???   That was the last straw for us. I just told him we needed the check. I felt a little bad because I got kinda snippy with him and it was not his fault so I explained to him why I was frustrated. While we were paying we noticed a burger and fries went past us and people were eating FULL meals as we walked out. Maybe they reset between 3 and 4 for dinner but someone should have explained that to us BEFORE we . This experience was horrible. I wouldn't suggest this to anyone.   Update: Never heard again from the owner despite correspondence via Yelp.

jWD2-d4ZcE8L-xESL7FCvw.text: Five Stars for sure!! What an amazing overall dining experience!!  From Brittany our server to the Salmon Pokestrada to my amazing Lobster Roll a truly exquisite culinary delight!!  Thank you Sea Level NC!

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon pokestrada
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ceviche

ZT4Y9s1M7enSI74af4Q68A.text: I've eaten here a few times and the food is always delicious, prepared by a tentative staff who understands how to host a restaurant and provide a quiet dining experience. They also did great with our corporate party :D

usH2s65rhFOHGMyw35Y2Ag.text: So I've had Sea Level in my bookmarks for quite some time. Last night, I was catching an event at Blumenthal after work, so what better way to kill time than to finally check out Sea Level.  The place is very hip. LOVE the outside seating, although tonight, since I was solo solo, I went for oyster bar seating. It is somewhat small inside.  I ordered four sea level oysters (HOLLA for happy hour, where their Sea Level oysters are $1.00 each (vs. the regular price of $1.75 each). After tasting the first one with their special vinaigrette "dressing", I should have ordered WAY more. BUT, I knew I was getting a cocktail & a lobster roll, so wasn't trying to get ahead of myself & spend a lot of money.  Somehow my drink order got forgotten, but my waiter multi-tasked & fixed it for me. The oysters ... AMAZING. My cocktail was so delightful. The Maine style lobster roll was quite tasty & lobster a plenty. The cole slaw was really good, too.  Pricey, pricey! But all in all worth it. Oyster bar staff was fun to chat with & my waiter (can't remember any of their names!) was great, too.  Will definitely be back!

oWW7H7OrCsdPHGVExEqt3A.text: I liked this place so much I came two days in a row. Sat at the oyster bar both nights. The guys working were friendly and informative. Food was delicious and tasted very fresh. The happy hour oyster deal is hard to beat and would definitely come back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Happy hour oysters

vf3PYJEQI4Eu5HlWdmpDvA.text: What fantastic seafood in uptown Charlotte! My wife and I went for the first time in August and it won't be our last. Excellent Pinot Noir! We shared the Calabash Shrimp for our appetizer-delicious! We also devoured the Clam Chowder, a Fish Taco, a Fried Oyster Taco, and the Shrimp and Grits. Everything was savory and had a great blend of flavor (and is sustainably sourced). Highly recommend! Not TOO pricey and the service was top notch. One of the best meals we've had in a long time.

upW3XbDSFQE4nuluqJ-DVA.text: We are seafood lovers which is why we selected Sea Level. It was our first time there. We were promptly seated and our server came a bit slowly at first and took our drink orders.  The drinks were over what you might expect to pay for other uptown restaurants but very well made.   A very nice and well put together menu with an eclectic selection of seafood and non-seafood items including but not limited to various spins on Rubens and cheese-steaks. I ordered the fried oyster salad as an appetizer, with my main course as the shrimp and grits. Both very good. I took advantage of the Queen's feast menu. My daughter ordered the watermelon salad which was delicious but as a 'shareable' it was about 6 ounces of fruit served on a third of a salad plate. She also ordered the bowl of lobster bisque which although good was again a small portion perhaps 6-8 ounces that of which comes in at $13. My husband ordered a fried shrimp po-boy with fries which was also very good, but again might not be so feasible for a casual date night coming in at $24.  Service was a bit slow, but our server was very polite and had a great demeanor. After all was said and done, we didn't quite feel like we had a $180 meal. Overall atmosphere was new age and clean with many special touches. Perhaps go for lunch or a drink and appetizer kind of night but if you're hungry and lighter on the wallet, you may consider something with more bang for your buck if you're hungry.

-gs_f9FLpDJ_d80yqPaC3w.text: We visited Sea Level before we went to see Trevor Noah. I didn't really have high expectations for the restaurant. It's right across the street from the theater and our friends wanted to check it out. I'm always down for new places so I decided to set up the reservations and make it happen. I'm not a huge fan of seafood, but the restaurant had a decent amount of "land" options. More importantly: they have corn fritters on the menu. That's how classy I am. I was down to go because of the corn fritters.   We arrived right on time for our reservations - they were on the early side so not many people were there yet. I really wish I remembered our waiters name because he was awesome. He checked in on us, joked with us, and genuinely cared about our experience. Part of why I liked the experience so much was because of him.  We ordered corn fritters, of course. They were so good. Not what I expected or was used to, but still legit. I also ordered a seasonal drink named, "Thyme for a drink". It was the perfect balance of sweet and fruity. I then ordered a burger and fries. I know, not original. But my boyfriend ordered fish and grits so he made up for my land order. More importantly, my friends husband ordered the paella. Holy cow. It looked amazing. Per his report: it tasted amazing. He even joked about getting another one for dessert.   Speaking of dessert, my boyfriend ordered the key lime ice cream sandwiches. He didn't finish them because the ice cream was extremely tart. I, on the other hand, ordered an apple-pie- bourbon-pecan concoction. I'm drooling about it now. My friend ordered the sundae and joked (but not really) about not sharing with us. We weren't even mad that she didn't because it was on the smaller side... and no one was going to even jokingly try to take it.  All in all, we had an extremely good time and were all pleasantly pleased with the restaurant. If you're seeing a snow, the location is very convenient... might as well make some reservations now!

OgismHuzE_EA4kKNtAU7Pg.text: I visited sea level for a friends birthday with his wife and my wife.  We came on a Friday night with bad weather out side but a huge positive was you don't even have to go outside to get to this place if you park in Hearst tower.  They validate too so you can park there for free.  Our friends were seated when we arrived right at the front door so a freezing draft hit us every time it opened, not that big a deal though.  So on to the food.  We ordered oysters, salmon tartar, a few different tacos, corn fritters, two lobster rolls and paella for one.  So I was the person that ordered the paella and thought that it would be tough to make it good with only say 15-20 minutes to prepare it and boy was I right.  They did a couple things correct, the bottom of the rice had the perfect amount of crust, the rice was cooked well as was the fish but there was just no flavor.  The dish needed salt, saffron, red pepper flakes and pepper.  There was no fresh herbs, no seasoning, no nothing.  So for $30 I got a decently cooked pan of rice, some white fish and shrimp.  The lobster rolls were tasty, very small but tasty, for $22 you would expect more but I am sensing a theme with this place.  We enjoyed the apps we had, solid, not spectacular.  The tartar and tacos are the way to go here, the entrees are overpriced and underwhelming.  The service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Key lime ice cream sandwiches
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paela
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn fritters

FUFb3kJsgCymlsFQTtWwvg.text: First time visiting, wanted to try it for awhile now and finally had the opportunity to. Unfortunately, a little disappointed about my visit.   The service was not the best. Our food took about 30 mins to arrive and our waiter forgot to put in our appetizer, so our entrees arrived before the apps. The waiter felt bad so he took care of the appetizer for free. But our app arrived close to our entrees being finished. Our waiter seemed like more preoccupied watching the Kentucky Derby and the hockey game on TV, so half our time was spent waiting on our waiter and the other half was spent waiting on our food and eating.   Not an overall good experience. Not sure if I'll be back but I may consider it a couple months down the line.

N2DhlNPdClshWsaXfYXEUw.text: Great oysters and amazing drinks! Food was superb  and the level of service was above and beyond. We will be back in the near future!

qojY3gSN1hJYu33dUMm5dg.text: Sat there for 30 minutes at the bar; never given the chance at a menu; no one approached me..... really; this place sucks

rPpZRK7OMRWMdcE69jQ81Q.text: Sea Level has a great ambiance and menu. Our table ordered a few of the Oyster Steamed Buns (which were absolute perfection), the Snapper Ceviche (very good, but a bit too sweet for a True ceviche fan who loves that acidic taste), the Sea Level Oysters (love love how SL has their own sauce to accompany. This added a cool flavor), the Shrimp and Grits (very average, the chorizo gravy was very bland for a southern palette). Our waitress, Kiara (sp?) was so bubbly. She added a great touch to our experience. Overall, we will be back for sure! Thanks SL.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

XuhGJ_ShzPtKXnKJP60lSg.text: Decided to press the reset button and try Sea Level after a bad experience 2 weeks. It something I said I would do. But I will change things a bit.  Greeted by the hostess. Different this time but still sweet. I came in on a Saturday at 1:30pm and sat at the bar. It wasn't that busy which is great. I was worry because St Paddy Parade was in full force outside. Greeted by Blanca. She brought me water and the menu. My bartender/waitress Audrea was the one who serviced me thru out the time there and Blanca backup when needed. These ladies are what services are suppose to me. They were tentative. One glance at Audrea. And she understood that I need her. So here's what I ordered:  6 raw oyster, varied picked by Audrea Corn Fritters Fish taco Oyster Taco  Mini salad Shrimp cocktail 2 snow crab claws Po boy sandwich  5 blushing bubbles drinks (yes I'm a lush)   A friend of mine like raw oysters. I like steamed oysters but since they don't offer steamed.  the oysters goes to him.. seem like he enjoyed it. Slurped it up quick. And I sure enjoy watch the guy behind the bar shucking it. I'm in love with the corn fritters. Crispy in the outside and fairly soft in the inside. No sauce needed. I really enjoyed the fried oysters Taco.. the batter oysters was different in a Taco and I can say I had one and will come back for more. Definitely can't complain about the shrimp cocktail, just wish the plating will be slightly different. I ordered soo much food that eventually the shrimps was sitting in a pool of water after the ice melts. But hey it went down the same place. I never had the snow crab claws before so I must say it's a treat and no wonder it's $5. If I didn't order some much food. I would just order that all night with the blushing bubbles and the corn critters. My friend enjoyed the Po Boy but I'm guessing not so much the fish Taco because he didn't finish it.  Overall I'm glad I hit the reset button. This time around, service was sooo much better., the food was excellent. I enjoyed the quietness of the restaurant and the ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome blushing bubbles. I had 4/5 of these. Yes I&#39;m a lush
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Varied oysters pick with Audrea (lovely bartender/waitress)
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad, oyster Taco, fish Taco and the lovely corn fritters

DEJ2ypPyX3MYpuCLhqosIA.text: I can only speak for two of the things, but I like $1 oyster happy hours and glasses of chilled white wine so I'm satisfied. I like that the happy hour goes from 4 - 7 which gives me plenty of time to get my oyster fix (and apparently it goes from 10 - 12 as well...which just means more opportunities). The oysters were fine -- good and briny, but not as cleaned out as I liked, but hey, it's $1. It's a good after work hang out place when you want to wind down in Uptown.  The salmon tartare was also pretty good but I wish it came with more jalapenos or at least had them diced up so I could get a spicy kick in every bite. Not sure if I'll come back for an actual dinner, but I'll definitely keep doing the $1 oysters.

KuFp44AL8nMihcBOMXJbuA.text: A group of my colleagues and I happened to be at Hearst Tower today and decided to try out Sea Level, a new restaurant located in the Hearst Tower that had just opened earlier this month.  On a Wednesday night, there were no reservations required as I think the restaurant is still fairly new and it's still pretty slow.  We were accommodated quickly.  I want to note that the service here, while a little bit slow, was great.  Our server was very friendly and there were always people asking us (a little too much sometimes) if we were done with our dish so they could clear it out.  Water was always full.  The GM also came over to chat and to make sure everything was alright, which we appreciated.  Prices are reasonable for seafood.  The food was a little lackluster... perhaps there are still a few kinks to sort out as this is such a new restaurant:  - No bread basket - you have to order it separately and it comes with a nice onion spread.  - Sea Level and Blue Point oysters - one of them, which I assume is the Sea Level, was itty bitty teeny tiny (I'm very small and have very small hands - see picture for scale) - literally smallest oyster I've ever seen.  However, both oysters were fresh (I haven't gotten sick!) and had a nice salty brine flavor.  Comes with all the condiments.  - Squid chow chow - we had no idea what a chow chow was and should have asked.  It's basically fried calamari tossed in peppers and onions in a sweet/spicy sauce.  It was really, really greasy and I felt like I was eating more batter than I was squid.  I had to spit out one that was all batter and no squid.  The flavors were good, though.  - Mussels - these were my favorite of the evening.  The sliced grilled baguettes went well with the butter/white wine/lemon sauce and the mussels were aplenty and fairly fresh.  I would recommend getting these!   - Lobster roll - unfortunately, both my coworker and I found lots of shell pieces in the lobster salad, which we both bit into.  My piece of shell was quite large and she had many little pieces in hers.  The GM was nice enough to comp both rolls, which was a nice gesture.  It's understandable that they might have some pieces of shell in them since they apparently get these really fresh and make their lobster salads on the spot, but it's still not an excuse - I've never had a shell problem with any lobster roll I've had.  The cole slaw had a nice pickled flavor to it, but I didn't eat much of it.  Overall, an okay place to have a dinner with colleagues as there is a lot of space and it's conveniently located in Hearst Tower, but I think there's still a few hiccups to remediate since it's so new.

fQ_giEygx_r_I-jympbuLw.text: We gave this spot a second try yesterday evening for dinner and tried some new items.  I have to say we were very impressed with the whole flounder...delicious & fresh!  We also tried the tempura shrimp appetizer and sword fish, which both were great options.  But we will most definitely be back for that flounder.  The service was awesome just as we remembered it!    I had high expectations for this place, but...it just didn't meet up to the hype as much as I thought.  The best part of the meal was the SERVICE honestly...our waiter was excellent!!!  She was very knowledgeable about the menu and had the best attitude.  As far as the food goes, we weren't too impressed.  We ordered the clam chowder, catfish Ruben, and catfish with grits.  The one thing we would come back for is the clam chowder.  The Ruben was ok, but the catfish wasn't really fresh. The best thing was my side...the braised greens were awesome!  And all of this was very over-priced for the quantity...we left hungry.  We would probably only come back for appetizers and drinks with friends.

xNwZYgynEIb1NDkTjye4jQ.text: A fantastic meal and great experience overall, we are already planning to return! The atmosphere was pleasant, a rare warm February day for outside dining. I had a shrimp cocktail with plenty of obviously fresh NC shrimp and house-maid cocktail sauce that all tasted great. The swordfish entree was likewise perfect and came with a wonderful lobster risotto. The tempura shrimp was absolutely perfect, and we are pretty snobby about shrimp. A colleague had the mussels and raved about them as well as her fish juice punch drink. I cannot recommend this place enough. And I would be remiss if I did not mention the fantastic service we received from Nate; thanks for the great dinner.

Great quality mussels that took up nearly the whole she'll. I thought the shrimp could have been larger and more tender but overall it was still a great dish.

0zEFyFO0yMYJy-dXX0_qbA.text: I came here for drinks on New Years Eve. I came here around 10pm, and the service was completely phenomenal. After a long busy day, you would think everyone would be tired and drained. The staff were definitely not! I was greeted at the bar immediately. The food was brought out at a decent time. Our bar tender checked on us frequently, but not too frequently.  Coming here was on accident. So I ordered a mixed drink and a pork bun. This place is great for drinks if you aren't into seafood. I would definitely return for more food

ErbPjIPIMBoe_fShgq1q6Q.text: Whenever I an headed uptown and crave seafood, one of my favorite spots is Sea Level. This relatively new restaurant has never disappointed, from the service to the cuisine and is the jewel of 5th street. Not only do they have happy hour oyster specials everyday (and I love oysters) but the special is always $1 oysters which is very reasonable. Their other dishes are great as well, but usually I get the oysters which have always been excellent. If you crave seafood, Sea Level should definitely be on your list.

5drNpcW8auZYHLoa3pKIBg.text: Everything was great. Better than I expected actually. Food was amazing, and the atmosphere was great. Service was also top notch. Would definitely recommend.

zmCm7Ltw5jUY_PKjx8NOyQ.text: The food was amazing.  We were out celebrating and birthday and would totally go back.  The waitress was very knowledgeable and had great suggestions.

nd_hMbWMnczqRA-86baWKg.text: The shrimp and grits were amazing! I was worried the grits would be too watery, which is the case at most places, but these were perfect! The staff was also very friendly, personable and informative too! Nate is a funny guy for sure! Recommend, all who are in the area, to try this place out!

fYIgM91fjdkmDl7PvXTUtA.text: Glad to have a good seafood joint in landlocked Charlotte! Well done Sea Level! The oyster happy hour is awesome. They also have a fantastic cocktail menu. Finally both entrees were amazing.

X7PsspGMD5_DPlD2dLRyjA.text: Not impressed. I honestly don't know why their ratings are that high, unless it was just a bad night. Server was nice, but had to ask her a couple times for everything. We ordered shrimp tempura, which definitely wasn't  a tempura batter, shrimp was a little iodiny. Corn fritters had hardly any corn to be found. They were bland. Good thing they came with a sauce. The Calamari chow chow would have been delicious if it  had not been so inedibly salty that we had to return them two times. The oysters were fresh and briny and delicious. They came with 2 types of mignonette and one of the bottles they came in was empty. A few of us ordered the veggie burger, which although it was good, it tasted like stuffing, not a veggie burger. It was made with sweet potatoes and topped with roasted tomatoes and caramelized onions and deep-fried with the tempura batter which the shrimp should've been battered with. It came with collards, too vinegary, and another side of sweet potatoes? Those were so good!! Really creamy and delicious! Dessert was the best part! Don't expect exceptional seafood here unless you're getting oysters. The end.

vAPW802sEXIvRyvn6xoPng.text: Such a great restaurant with a genuine reputation for good locally sourced seafood. From the first time my boyfriend and I visited the staff made us feel like regulars. We always sit at the bar and the bartenders are always ready to engage in conversation. We have attended a few of the Monday night oyster sessions and are always impressed by the quality of the food. Drinks are also amazing. Great assortment of oysters. I always recommend this place to my clients.

6GyJtlZFHnjS6Sg7gtpG8g.text: The food was only okay, but the service was good. The oyster happy hour is great ($1 oysters). The mussels were good but there were a lot of empty shells in ours. The salmon and the "fried rice" accompaniment came in super small portions, and the rice tasted more like vinegar than anything else.

9z4TgMcPj9rckm-olr88Qg.text: Within walking distance from the Spectrum center, we stopped here on a Friday in lent and were not disappointed.  The restaurant is very modern and upscale.  Their oyster list boasts their own oyster they work with local providers to offer.  My fish taco was very well dressed and filling.  The Hubbs got the catfish Reuben and liked it.  It's slightly on the pricier side but worth it.

TNvVaHx0Le8LWllWnnJQyg.text: I was recently in Charlotte from Friday - Sunday and managed to stumble upon Sea Level.  I came upon it and never ate anywhere else.  I was there for Friday dinner and Saturday lunch and dinner.  The restaurant is beautiful first off.  It has such an inviting atmosphere.  The food was incredible.  Throughout the weekend I had the Lobster Roll, Clam Chowder and the Paella.  Being from Connecticut, I am very particular about my lobster roll...this did not disappoint.  It was one of the best I have ever had!  The clam chowder was great l and I can't even begin to describe how flavorful and just all around amazing the Paella was.  I am only a beer drinker but the cocktails that were made looked so good!  One of the best parts was the staff and their attentiveness to the patrons.  Jon and Scott were beyond personable and it was like I had known them for quite some time.  I want to thank the whole staff that I interacted with (I know I forgot a few) because you all made my trip to Charlotte even better.  Whether you live in Charlotte or are just visiting you have to check this place out and plan on never wanting to leave!

TiOJTCT1QTIk1iShCjNEmg.text: Stopped in one Friday after work, and was really pleased. The service was friendly and the food was great.   I had the shrimp steam buns with a side of fries. The shrimp reminded me more of a deviled crab, but was really good. The fries were your typical run of the mill hand cut fries, which is just what I wanted.   My boyfriend got the shrimp po'boy with slaw. It was pretty good, no frills but that's exactly what he wanted, a good old fashioned po'boy.   We also tried the sea level oysters which run $1.75 normally but were on special for $1 (it's a happy hour thing from 4-7). They were delicious, easily worth $1 each.   The feel of the place was kind of hard to gauge because it was 4:30 on a Friday -- not very busy. I'd like to go back later one night to see how it feels at peak business hours. Also curious to see if the service suffers any when busy because it was top notch when I went.   I definitely plan to go back and definitely recommend this place!

fmVUEuQUP4YtWdVVl8-AGQ.text: Being COMPLETELY new to North Carolina, I was a bit skeptical about going to the number one ranked place for happy hour as I think that the best places usually aren't ranked number one.... and I suppose that that's still probably True as I didn't get to go to every happy hour hot spot... but I can say that this place was AWESOME!  We had a group of 5 of us... mixed eaters/drinker styles... we sat outside, which is honestly a strange place to be because you can't really make out wether you're inside or outside.... but anyway, here we were "outside", and our lovely server "Kierrah" greeted us... she's a major reason we had such a phenomenal experience... I'm not sure how the other servers are, but she was so absolutely incredible with service that I might be disappointed if I returned and it wasn't her.  Anyways, they update their menu very frequently. And the first thing I noticed was that they had two cocktail options that were charitable. If you bought one of these $10 cocktails, the business would donate $5 to Hurricane Irma efforts. Superb. I love it.  There were, however, much more attractive cocktail options to me that were so unique and creative that I had to give them a try. I loved them and tried my friends' and loved theirs too. Major props.  My friends were super stoked about the $1 oyster happy hour special and everyone enjoyed the different food they ordered... wait just kidding, my boyfriend wasn't a fan of the shrimp poboy that he ordered (but he's French and super picky)... anyways, everyone else was happy! I believe a Reuben, tartare, and clam chowder were ordered.  Great place to stop for drinks and meet up with people!  The music was GREAT!!!! I nearly forgot! And that was one of the reasons I was okay with stopping here! You can always tell a lot by a places taste in music.

g_gQk1JAkcnCpZ6dp4yBgA.text: Overall the dining experience was first rate!  Our server Nate was very friendly, engaging, and informative.  All the food was very high quality and tasty. We started with the $1 Happy Hour oysters.  Fresh and delicious.  The clam chowder was next, very hearty.  I had the Triggerfish, my wife the Salmon salad, and my son the Catfish.  All dinners were generous in portion and flavorful.  The only reason I'm not giving Sea Level 5 stars is due to the fact that they up charged $3 for ice cubes for each of our cocktails.  $3 for an ice cube-seriously???  I ordered a Johnny Black on the rocks and my son a Bourbon on the rocks and both were charged for the ice.  Either tell us up front there is a charge for Ice or bury that charge in the cost of the drink.  Just not cool.

p6mZ4Sv3CKmt906rCwdRlg.text: The food was okay. Just a bit too over thought. The shrimp po boy (which is a classic southern dish and I'm a classic southerner) was not the over flowing small golden brown shrimp on a soft roll. Instead it was these heavenly breaded large over cooked shrimp on this giant dense roll. I'm a purest so maybe some ppl like this but it's not the traditional sandwich. They also have a "rueben" on the menu that was recommended to me by the server. I said I don't care for thousand island/Russian dressing and she stated it didn't come with that...again a classic sandwich without the classic details (and seafood and cheese..no).  The positives are the atmosphere and the salads. My friend got the apple and endive with salmon and raved about it. I'll try this place again but I will come at night when I can try some of their cocktails. Cocktails without soda b/c their selection is from a local company and let's just say they skimp on the carbonation.

oEUZ51u4nqFrEoEHFoWzxw.text: Last weekend, my girlfriend treated me here as it was my birthday weekend, and even though I'd never heard of this place until now, I REALLY wish I had. Food was amazing (especially the clam chowder), atmosphere was great, and our waiter, Nate, was absolutely the best. 100% the best experience I've had from a waiter, gave us great recommendations, and was generally gave us a great dining experience. Major props to him!

DHUa44GtZP8rXglHh5BS4Q.text: This place has a very cool atmosphere.  It also has an extensive menu.  We were just there for drinks and a snack.  Ergo, I had the shrimp cocktail.  Too often, the once ubiquitous app is overpriced and boring but theirs was quite good.  It was a large serving (a dozen good sized shrimp) with a very good cocktail sauce.  Go ahead and stir that extra horseradish they bring you in and enjoy the burn!  My wife had the key lime iced cream cookie and it was also very tasty.  The drinks were pricy.  My wife had a mocktail of some sort that became s little too sour over time.  Otherwise, we had a good time and enjoyed the place very much.

LPlLp5WqoAmQSPBmICjVog.text: decided to drop in for dinner on nye - which may or may not have been a good decision. The hostess was really rude. I can't stand it when you walk into a place and the host acts like she doesn't see you and then when you try and get her attention she gives you a rude snippy response. A smile, and "I'll be right with you," would have been great .. instead we started our dinner with her snotty attitude. At any rate, the person who seated us and our waiter made up for the rude hostess. We both had specialty drinks - Manhattan and old fashioned, both sub par. (Menu indicates a luxardo cherry in my manhattan which is always appreciated but what i got was not a luxardo). We tried the chicken bao which was so delicious we almost got another. The ceviche was OK, it needed some more tang/lime. It bothered me that the leafy green it came with had all kinds of holes in it... but moving on, we shared the lobster roll and swordfish over a lobster risotto. Lobster roll was also ok, nothing to write home about. Swordfish on the first attempt came out with undercooked rice which we couldn't deal with since undercooked rice definitely causes stomach aches. The waiter gladly took it back and apologized. It came back, still slightly undercooked but fine. It just took away from this creamyness that you look forward to with risotto. The swordfish was also just ok, a little over cooked in my opinion and lacked flavor. We were really hoping to be blown away by this place but instead were left a little disappointed.

EIv-YTtA2PjX0nF-0QqHIA.text: What can I say! I'm a huge fan of raw oysters and if you tell me $1 happy hour oysters, I'm there!! I came here on a Monday evening specifically for their HH oysters which they offer Mon-Sat from 4-7pm and 10-12am. Parking is easy. I recommend parking in the Hearst Plaza, where the restaurant is located. The restaurant offers 3 hours validation for dinner and 2 hours for lunch. Our server Mike was super friendly and great!! Too bad their HH menu is only limited to oysters which is why the 4-stars. However, the oysters were very fresh and I would definitely recommend coming here for HH if you're an oyster lover like me.

vh_rJ-7Nqno_e4eHZU59Yw.text: Went to sea level after a hornets game just before the holiday and at 1st I was a little afraid that our food wasn't gonna be fresh because the only other people in the whole restaurant was sitting at the bar! However one of the managers was our servers, so the service was on point everything was piping hot fresh and exceeding expectations! This was my first time coming here aside from restaurant week! This has now become one of my favorites. And please try the oyster taco it's OMG!

q-d4VenjVSunefSx8-ytsA.text: Sea Level was good, service was great... Went there during lunch probably the best time as there was no one I'm the restaurant.. we were seated right away and I decided to do the pick 3 lunch special with the fish taco, shrimp steam bun with my sides as the adluh Mills grits....   The food was delicious the taco was juicy and had tons of flavors, my absolute favorite was the shrimp steam bun sandwich that was AMAZING the grits we're a little gritty definitely not the old southern grits you get from Mom's or gma so it's an acquired taste and could have probably used so cheese in the grits.. that was one of my only gripes..  My other gripe is that I felt like it wasn't enough food for lunch like I was still hungry afterwards.. other than that it was good food experience.
