rsoIrw5H7r-ZWBsKZi6XFA.text: Great food and service. Ordered the Sea Level and NC wild oysters along with the corn fritters and was not disappointed. Cocktails are delicious as well. The Sea Level oysters were fairly small but everything else was great.

OAvrmttTkwh5cyEK9gogyQ.text: Great atmosphere! The food is always great. The service is why I gave only 4 stars. Sometimes I haven't had the warmest greetings from the servers. I will still come back.

jOoY3ixR05Lc7SJZZCTU1A.text: Are you guys REALLY asking about GENDER NEUTRAL bathrooms??? Get a life.   this place is great, oysters in August. A little pricey, but truly great. We had Duck Tacos and Fried Oyster Tacos...we'll return for sure.

a6T8D-2gVi7A_P37sIn-TA.text: The food was expensive and not really that good. The waiter took over 20 minutes to take our drink order after we were seated. The ceviche was mostly corn with 3 small pieces of fish. Very disappointed

7NdHQp_CC4oYjqLTC9kikQ.text: Love this place. Great service. Went for lunch. Enjoyed the clam chowder and fish taco. Shared braised greens with a co-worker. They were awesome!!  Highly recommend this place.

ftqF_LZHwbu5m1lPmV6_dQ.text: Let me just say, the food was fantastic. The oysters were so fresh; even the NC ones that were $2...not very gamey, the corn fritters were great. Everything about the place and their menu is top notch and great eats. I'd give it 5 stars alone for that.  But the service we experienced last night was garbage. Absolute garbage. I'll do bullet points to save on the fluff: - As a party of 7, a couple of people in our group only managed to get one drink ordered (alcohol), and the rest of the time we had to flag the guy down to get more after patiently waiting since it was starting to get crowded. - When we did manage to get his attention after waiting for long enough, he directly told our table "wait a minute", in a rude and gruff voice and didn't even stop to explain it, cutting me off when I was trying to explain myself. - He was waiting on people at the bar in an area that's clearly run by the bartender. - He was more fixated and chatting up the table next to ours, which coincidentally happened to be all women. - Multiple times, when I was sitting out menus for my friends to join me, he'd deliberately come back and put them back in between the salt and pepper shaker. Not once. MULTIPLE times.  There was nothing inviting about him, we had to wait forever to order more drinks, and when we couldn't, and tried to politely get his attention, he'd brush us off without so much as a word out of our mouths. I don't ever make a scene in a restaurant or ask for a manager, but the service was literally so bad I almost went to the manager and had them deduct our automatic gratuity. I don't know if he was just in a bad mood, or if he thought that because his tip was going to be automatically included that he could just get away with doing a pretty poor job...but that kind of attitude needs to be left at the door, not at work where you're trying to make people feel welcome.  So kudos to Sea Level for the amazing cuisine and super fresh oysters, but if I were to go back, I'd turn around and walk out if I saw the same guy working.

O4Yf0zJVsbfeAz9CIrKRUg.text: I really liked the atmosphere and the customer service deserved 5 stars.  Everyone was very attentive from the hostess to our waitress to other staff members.  The reason for my 3 stars is the food.  The clam chowder was really good but the soft shell crab sandwich was just ok.  Maybe my expectations were too high, but the price was not worth the sandwich.  They also don't offer seafood dinners, which is what I was hoping for.  Everything was in the form of a sandwich.

qdd-Xqo-klue1Lj54O54HQ.text: Service was great and the oyster selection is the best in Uptown, but I was disappointed in the limited selection of fish options available for dinner...

6brAgfqgOVrGu9dnYe0yXQ.text: We came here on New Year's Eve. We had great service. I love that we could make a reservation with Yelp! My cocktail was a seasonal drink. It was nice but not memorable. My husband and I thought the Appetizers were amazing! I will probably order more of these next time. I had an oyster steam bun and he ate a duck taco. He also enjoyed an oyster shooter. Our entrees were just ok. I had a lobster roll and fries. I wish they would make the lobster roll Connecticut style (lobster meat sauteed with clarified butter; no mayo) instead of New England style (mayo). My husband's main entree was shrimp and grits. He said it was average. I would come back and try something else... definitely more appetizers but I wish they would really consider offering a Connecticut-style lobster roll (sorry for my plea as I know I'm being redundant). Also, their decor was modern and their bathrooms were clean.

u27WzHIkudwoINPStP_Raw.text: My husband and I went here for dinner last night, and the entire experience was amazing.  Tyler, our server, offered outstanding recommendations from the oysters all the way to the dessert.  I love that this restaurant has such a focus on locally-sourced seafood.  Everything we ate was delicious.  We started with an oyster sampler, moved on to clam chowder (best I've ever had--tons of clams inside), I had the NC striped bass and my husband had the lobster roll, and we finished with a s'mores shooter.  Thanks for the great service, Tyler.  We will be back!

M0MdoqcDpEjg7bmKjymiqA.text: Have been to Sea Level several times and enjoyed it.  The food is great (especially the oysters) and the service is excellent.  On this occasion, we went during Queen's Feast and ordered off the Queen's Feast menu.  My husband had the oyster appetizer and I ordered the ceviche.  The oysters were unusually small and the ceviche was disappointing.  For entrees, he had the catfish served on a bed of creamed corn polenta that he said was good and I had the short rib with summer squash.  The tarragon sauce served with the vegetables was surprisingly delicious because I didn't think I'd like tarragon and the short rib was, as usual, tenderorni and excellent.  For the dessert, we both had the bourbon chocolate pound cake which was ok.  The reason for four stars is more about the Queen's Feast menu than the restaurant.  Yes, you get to sample some of the quality menu items at a reduced price ($35 each). But the servings are just "samples" or what my husband calls "Froo-Froo" (i.e. pretty on the plate but less than filling).  Ok for me, but I'm a small eater.  As always, the service was excellent, but next time, we'll order from the regular menu.  It might even cost a little more for him, less for me so it will average out.  But, he won't have to eat again when we get back home.

GsNENfxV3l1zRmV1L5g_3g.text: Some of the most creative cocktails I've had in Charlotte and all of the food was great. The clam chowder is a must try.

TlR7ORg3VVJ-T0vXrm2Z1A.text: The food and service was excellent.  This was my third visit and it happened to be restaurant week.  The oysters were delicious.  I also had shrimp and grits as well as the ound cake for dessert.  The place was super busy but that didnt impact our services.  Definitely a great spot uptown.

ccGbbw5CcEddk8OuRtSgmw.text: I had an absolute wonderful meal before going to see "The King and I"  I would definitely recommend giving this restaurant a try:)

92eKlpN8JOxtuH4VlJV-7w.text: We had a wonderful experience at Sea Level!  The tequila and oyster pairings were fun and delicious...definitely would recommend.  Some of the best oysters I've ever had.  Service was also on point.

mWbQDffWrILRoe7ytF8S_A.text: We stopped in around 6pm before a hornets game and was able to snag a seat at the bar. They have $1 house oysters from 4-7. We took advantage and got 12 sea level oysters. Although they were on the small side they were incredibly fresh with just enough salt to satisfy. Woods was our bartender and was incredibly personable and knowledgable. He made us their vodka infused oyster shooter and it had to be one of the best we've had. Hints of pickle juice and a subtle smokiness and heat in the back end. Highly recommend. Have woods make you a drink and take advantage of the happy hour oysters. You won't be disappointed.

xvRnTHVcaqsm3-lT0_z44w.text: Fun times!  Went for a group outing with about 15-20 of us.  We had two tables on a Friday night.  Started out with oyster shooters, pork belly tacos, and oysters.  Great beer selection too.  I got the grouper and wife got the veggie burger, both were awesome!  Cool place to eat and drink.

GuV4RuEkfVTYWRJUGXNAXg.text: Great place for lunch.  Service was good and quick.  I ordered the fish taco and pork belly steam bun with the corn fritters.  They were all delicious and I was in and out in less than an hour.

X29bsUZmMJvsTEkVpHiDRQ.text: The best clam chowder hands down. Ariel was an amazing waitress. Costumer service top notch. I highly recommend it!

WMFuN6JtaLgZKMLBllixUw.text: I am not a huge seafood fan since shellfish makes me queezy. However, my date loves it. So we went and I was not disappointed. The vibe is very nice and the restaurant itself is a good size. I had the corn fritters as an appetizer. They were extremely good with the spicy dipping sauce. I also had the chicken which came with greens in a demi glaze...fantastic! I also had the parmesan potato cakes. Another great hit. My date had a shrimp po boy and she liked it as well. I will definitely be back!

0ux01cmwVoKGg5RMFbJPrw.text: Went to Sea Level last night for dinner (Friday night) with a couple of girlfriends.  And we actually ran into two other tables of people we knew.  We totally loved it!  The servers were super sweet (and cute too!) and perfectly attentive.  We ordered a couple of beers and apps to start.  I especially liked the corn fritters.  The shrimp tempura was a little too fried for my taste - but pretty good.  We ordered the oysters - cause you have to :) - which were delish - and then we did our main meal.  I had the Catfish Reuben and it was so good!  I got a side of carrots, which sounded sorta boring, but I was trying to be healthy :).  The carrots came out in a little pot and were deliciously grilled - surprisingly good!  I would have liked to have a bit more slaw on my plate with he sandwich, but otherwise was happy.  Everyone loved their meals - one girlfriend got the Lobster roll, which was insanely delish.  The soft shell crab sandwich was the slight disappointment as it was a bit too fried for my friend's taste.  We had the apple tart for dessert - and so should you - awesome!  Overall it was a great experience, fun way to start off the night and I will definitely be back.

TyCognMEXN5d6AW9UgJHPA.text: Beautiful decor on the outside of the restaurant. Have a great deal on oysters from sea level for $1 each from 4-6, highly recommend!! The fish tacos were okay, but the fish wasn't very flavorful. The smores shooter for dessert was absolutely incredible! Marshmallow on top with cookie crumbs, and brownie in between layers. Would come back just for oysters and dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smores shooter- incredible!

uKbeqkXOre_fg8Pf2ALEZQ.text: Scott was fantastic, guiding us through the fresh oyster menu and other features.  Everything exceeded expectations.  From craft cocktails, Oyster shooters, Lobster Roll, and their Saturday preparation of Wreckfish.  Delightful experience, highly recommend!!

GPxlmBXlsCACuu9dTcvw2w.text: Amazing!! I had the shrimp and grits! The flavor is excellent!! My wife ordered the seafood paella and it was rocking!! Their shrimp is cooked just right!! The eclair is the recommended dessert!

WYtzo8k6BGYRZS2-Wn4NfQ.text: We ate at Sea Level on a Saturday night around 6:00 pm, before a symphony concert. It was much too loud and made the meal very unpleasant. The food was mixed. I had clam chowder to start and salmon main course. Both were very good. My wife had fritters to start and soft-shell crabs, her favorite. The fritters were good but the crabs were too breaded and much too dry. She asked for a sauce to give them some moisture and they brought tarter sauce, inappropriate for this dish.  We will not return.

pQW3l1CGcax_83hqjon6zQ.text: This was my first time here and I ate at the bar, not a mistake, very helpful bartenders with food and drinks.  The sides as wells as the fresh fish were phenomenal, can't wait to get back next time I'm  in Town.

xi--gTmKaf7B-PuNRBip7A.text: This place was so terrible. Leaving now, our order was wrong, all of the food came out cold, we told Our server and nothing was done to rectify it- no discount, no new food, no apology. Service was awful and food was worse. Don't go here

C2WhVN8C89v9B4zN6SDKdA.text: My husband and I had been wanting to try this for awhile. It was worth the wait!  The atmosphere was lively. The servers and hostess staff were friendly and attentive. I had the lobster roll which was delicious and the Parmesan Tator tots!  They were the best. I even recommended them to a couple who sat down next to us as we were leaving.

MCpY-9O_heovFv1AF1ISEw.text: I work in Hearst tower so I normally go for lunch l, but I've also been in for a fancy after work cocktail. The drink menu is impressive and the bartenders are great. At lunch I recommend the pick 3... fried oyster taco and corn fritters must be 2 of the 3!!

J3af9GgyNiEZPQP69aVhLA.text: Really awesome - the type of place Uptown needs.  Went last night, got seated immediately even missing part of our party. We had a cocktail while waiting (which was awesome) and ordered an appetizer and oysters. I didn't eat the oysters but was told they were awesome. The shrimp steam bun was really great too!  As for entrees at our table - lobster roll, catfish reuben, and risotto. My friend from Massachusetts had the lobster roll and gave it the seal of approval. The catfish reuben was amazing, and the risotto got a good review.  All in all I am so excited to have this place uptown and will be a frequent visitor! Price is really reasonable also.

ravaH-GDjEZJ2jnyaHKIiA.text: I'm amazed to find such an authentic Southern seafood place in a metro area. Not quite as "fusion" as one might expect.  It was a nice experience, and enjoyed the atmosphere a great deal. I highly recommend this in you're in downtown looking for seafood.

w0DMWnkqAMtl0JSvB2-L7g.text: Decided to go here for a little girls night & so glad my friend chose this place! It was a little hard to find at first but could be because I'm horrible at directions ... all the staff here are so attentive & sweet ! Nate however, the best server ever !!! Know everything on the menu & takes care of you ! Very outgoing guy! Will def he back ASAP! We need more Nate's in this world ! Oysters are outstanding

s-O9ltKpQRBV4cTeYeTwyA.text: Wow, where do I begin? I went to Sea Level a few nights ago for dinner with a friend. We were promptly and cheerfully greeted upon entering. This restaurant has a beautiful modern atmosphere with a trendy twist. The shift manager made a point to stop by our table and ask us how our food and service was. This was such a nice touch. It was pretty busy that night and we really felt taken care of. I wish I could remember the name of the cocktail I ordered but it was delicious. The server made lots of wonderful recommendations and I was super thrilled with what I decided to get.  This was such a nice treat for me and my friend! I will be sure to recommend this place to all of my friends and family in the area. We will definitely be back !

QuwGl4PGytfRQ0ovGI30qA.text: The food was really good and the restaurant was very nice and clean. Andrew was our server and he was wonderful!

v2pg1c7NIY4_axRImxQqNA.text: i came here to pick up food on 2 occassions. once was for lunch and the other for dinner. for lunch i had ordered the pork belly slider, clam chowder and fries. the pork belly slider was rock hard. i did not have the patience to break my teeth eating it as i expected a braised pork/tenderness. needless to say i threw the pork belly out. i ate the buns which had a sad smear of sauce but there wasnt much else to it. the fries were decent, cant mess those up can you? the clam chowder was extremely salty. so salty that i had to gulp some water every few sips of clam chowder. separately for dinner i had the lobster roll which sounded and perhaps looked better than what i got. it came with fries and then i separately ordered a fried oyster slider. the fried oyster was tasty, but something didnt feel/taste fresh about the fried oyster so my gut was to stop eating it. the lobster roll i had was also mediocre. i dont know if taking the food to go had anything to do with the food presentation. i had high hopes since their menu brought me back twice but disappointed twice

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. lobster roll and fried oyster slider and fries to go

Ljt2L9UnEt66I07Qp0M-iw.text: I don't normally post reviews unless they are really bad or really good. Sea Level was outstanding in both food & service. Our waiter, Nate, was super friendly w/o being annoying. He made excellent recommendations and was so pleasant. We had the corn fritters, ceviche, oysters & clam chowder to start and they were all excellent. Salmon, swordfish and shrimp and grits were next and everyone enjoyed. To top it all off, the strawberry ice cream sandwich hit the spot. Kudos to the chefs, staff and the best waiter in town, Nate. Seafood at its finest.

Sq0ureu1o1vovB3VFsa7Tg.text: We were there last night with a group of 8. Arrived with no wait at 6:30PM table was ready. This is restaurant week in Charlotte at participating restaurants and Sea Level was one of them. Menu is preset at $35.00 each for this with appetizer, entree and desert. our service was outstanding. Everyone enjoyed their choice of food. Parking is free in The Hearst Tower parking garage, The restaurant is on the 3dr level. The restaurant will validate your parking receipt for free parking. This is one of the many must try if your are in uptown Charlotte.

Uagyav0xs9sX45VssIcVDQ.text: Lovely Discovery! We were traveling back from Florida, and happened upon this really nice seafood restaurant. Awesome shrimp and grits! My husband had the sword fish. Good mixed drinks, also. Plus, it was a lovely night, and we were able to sit out on the Terrace.

JDdcyUvnefVbz3Xg-gucJA.text: Not terrible.  The striped bass was decent.  But, the atmosphere is more like a sports bar (loud with duchy patrons) than a fine seafood establishment.   Most people seemed to enjoy the raw snots.  I would give them another try under the right circumstances.

Vj6Zm3JIuEX7kgjKr8CkiQ.text: I was so excited to try this place. I work in the building and have been watching its progress for months. I've waited a bit as I'm reluctant to try places when they first open so they could work out the kinks. My husband and I gave it a shot tonight.   We Ordered our drinks and the corn fritters and a bowl of the clam chowder to start. The corn fritters were just ok. They were a bit dry  but the aioli was delicious with a nice kick. The clam chowder was good but $9 for a small bowl is outrageous. It didn't even come with bread or crackers or anything.   For dinner I got the tile fish which was just ok. It wasn't cooked right and lacked flavor. My husband ordered the lobster roll which was again just ok and I thought dry and lacking flavor. I wouldn't go back for any of the items we had.   Another peeve was the waitress asked us if we wanted dessert while we were still eating. We politely declined and said not yet. Five minutes later she brought our check. We would have gotten another drink and possibly dessert after we were done eating our dinner but felt rushed out at that point and just decided to leave.   I think this place has great potential if it listens to the reviews and works out the service kinks.

SupXMOnRJPbiHCKQvqZQBg.text: WOW!  We had the NC Paella, sea level oysters and NC grits and shrimp. It was delicious, more than food it was a taste experience! Service was fantastic! Highly recommend.

e0m6Ehf1LXYTohGzuqQAuw.text: Took my husband to Sea Level on a Saturday evening for Fathers Day.  We were excited to try them for the first time.    Cons: 1) I made reservations and asked for a booth but was seated at a table. And they weren't packed so they could have accommodated.   2) We were really disappointed in the food.   It was a bit bland.   Pros: 1) The drinks are strong.  2) The wait staff was nice.

zAsMEPiKCu3YkPVwlVkb8Q.text: Sea Level is my new "go to" bar/restaurant when in Charlotte.  It's a nice bar that has a down to earth vibe and an upscale feel.   I particularly like their oyster selection and their service is very good.    Give it a try.

8bdYh7GtlD2i4i_3QS3f8g.text: The oysters are fresh and tasty, and reminds me of either Florida or New Orleans for their taste.  You cannot beat the location as it is in the CENTER of uptown Charlotte so you can attend many different venues after.  Check it out!

nFUso3BPKlqsG_BokFuxXg.text: I love the oyster happy hour on the wknd!! The restaurant food is decent, I mainly go for the oyster. Would definitely recommend!

FV-shaSRgYYHhJjX5p2pmA.text: Sea Level never disappoints. I often go for happy hour oysters and they are filled with flavor.

0fkw2C4weQlyNLnEP2r5Ng.text: The food is good here and the atmosphere is laid back which makes a great date night or chill spots with friends .   You are instantly transformed into a different atmosphere with classy upscale place to the point you almost forget you are in Charlotte.   We had appetizers and food. The tacos were somewhat small but the fried chicken sandwich was huge! It was really good and worth the shot.   I would give this place a try for yourself and I know they $1 oyster nights.

-JJYyJ2pXvI4hgqn0Magxw.text: Nate, hands down best server in CLT! Great food and great service ! Cocktails are amazing! Thai Salmon and Paella, and the spicy tequila drink was awesome! Sit outside if you can, love their style and locally sourced food!

ygcXpygqYSicdkFOVT762Q.text: Nice location downtown loud atmosphere mediocre food but excellent service. Could be a lot more creative with the menu and the portions and plating.

KLIoa9UWzpKmMjleQqbvlw.text: Great food and super service.  Nate was our expert waiter. I can be picky and high maintenance at times but Nate's intuitive pace, timing and knowledge of the food was impressive. He was able to explain the restaurant's concept and how the food is  sourced.   This is an oyster fans paradise. They even have a oyster shot for those that are interested. Outdoor seating and a dining area that is well appointed and intimate; great for conversation.  This was my 1st time here but will definitely be back again.

u1f1EZeMwekFzDqo2dHFwA.text: Really excellent place!  I was by myself and, so, ate at the bar. Bartender was super friendly and helpful. I had the grilled salmon  with quinoa which was great and cooked to perfection. The draft beer (OMB Copper) was just to my taster. Place WASN'T cheap but worth it!

lHjlmekufVF9cHKr79_buA.text: MUST GO! Servers are educated and food is superb. Decor absolutely goes hand in hand with the type of food served and amazing experience you will receive. One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Get everything.

877VbMN2Wiq7wX_bBVcWwg.text: If you want to go to a high end date, this is the place to splurge!  The seafood tower is a must have!  Pricey but worth every morsel.

kbcClpoSE4zji3zhOwhlkw.text: I came here for my birthday and I enjoyed their fish tacos. Really nice ambiance, prime location uptown in between tons of night time action... great place...good food

Xjg-sla4ZjLvLYldw5E7kg.text: The service is great, but not the food. Sorry 2 give a bad review. Im so sorry! I wish the food was better

LZC2E_kgAQp3-MMgsKpFVw.text: Love server Nate! Love the quality and the food. Everything is always awesome and cannot recommend enough!

jK4o6uhQvyYdoBd7C6wCPw.text: We had an early dinner in uptown Charlotte at Sea Level NC. They are a great recent addition to the fabulous choices for eating in that area. Their decor is modern and understated stylish. Lots of exposed brick and wood. It appeared to be a place where food and drinks should be the star. And that was indeed what we found !    They have a incredible farm to fork raw oyster menu. It changes constantly depending on the season and what's available. We had a dozen of mixed oysters. All fresh and delectable. Washed them down with a  craft cocktail called Melting NY Sour. It was what my husband called a "man's drink".    The clam chowder was literally overflowing with fresh clams in a flavorful thick soup chowder. Next up were their mussels. Plump and tasty. Mussel rule #108  don't forget to use the bread for sopping up the mussel broth!   Shrimp and Grits were simply prepared low country style. Uber flavorful gravy with a perfect amount of kick and creamy grits. Very filling and satisfying. A glass of Chardonnay went perfect with this dish.   Hubby order a classic Lobster roll. Huge hunks of lobster on greens and a remoulade sauce on a lightly toasted bread was fantastic. They let the lobster just be lobster. Why mess with perfection. Rose' was his wine choice.   A perfect spot to have our last meal of 2016 . Service was friendly and professional. Never underestimate how important southern hospitality is to a restaurant experience. Sea Level NC can put anyone in their culinary happy place !

Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp n grits
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

dV6sAb8lmsii1aXxSot-vg.text: Sea Level atmosphere, waitstaff, and architecture are great. We went on Friday night and there was a bit wait. However the food was delicious, it is worth the wait. We will certainly be back.

45a5ciU89pITXTiA79YotA.text: Best restaurant experience  ever! Great service and great food. We had the lobster rolls with the corn fritters... AMAZING! Buttery goodness.

0QoDEDNxf-fox433eNUomA.text: All I came in for was the bar and the raw bar! Both get two thumbs up! The NC oysters were amazing. The bourbon selection top notch. I'm coming back!!

HSWF-V1tY247RsimfX2jLQ.text: Awesome restaurant with a nice variety of fresh seafood & craft cocktails! Excellent service with attention to detail.

jXzeBuwS-JocdE1jYbcRNw.text: First visit here and was pleased. This was not a planned stop otherwise would have made sure I made it for one of the two windows for $1 Oysters. I have had their oysters before and they are good so will be back to visit for one of my favorite things in life.  This occasion we ordered some yummy apps and beers. Had a shrimp bun, pork bun, and fried oyster taco. My favorite was the pork bun and would recommend that at around $5. I was really looking forward to the oyster taco as the fried oysters were good but some of the flavor was lost because the aioli seemed to overpower. Was way too much. Maybe just needs a little lemon instead or at least simmer down a bit on how much aioli. Food all in all is solid.  Service was fantastic and while bellying up to the bar the bartender seemed very knowledgeable about the menu. He made some great recommendations on oysters and the sandwich's. He mentioned the grouper so may come back for that one and some oysters. Usually my go to would be the lobster roll but maybe a little overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some yummy apps at 5.50 a piece.

3lELlUmtA8eilN04gMPOFw.text: Food was amazing. Outdoor ambience was one of the best in the city. I loved the sea food, mocktail, and dessert.

kzlqHuRIO-M8viZeRYUf3Q.text: The second visit was even better than the first.  The oysters were outstanding!!!  The service was great and I would definitely stop by if you are in the area

LHEelH_2mlz02A1eJ7_gbQ.text: I had a very nice fish plate for dinner.  Great ambiance, great food and great drink selection.   I was a bit surprised given the name that they did not have a really extensive fresh fish menu though...  Mostly have gone for drinks which is also good.  Its a bit pricey for someone cheap like me, but probably good if you want to live it up.  Be careful on windy days, the door opens and blows into the bar and knocks everything around!

lXMex5--Wi_Nni18VXx44g.text: My dinner group met here recently because it's been on our bucket list for a while.  Aside from some confusion with our table reservation, we were seated within a few minutes of the reservation at a large booth.  The menu consists of oysters and other seafood offerings.  Some of our table ordered appetizers to share and the mussels were absolutely amazing. I'm not a big fan of mussels but these were tender with a flavorful broth. The corn fritters were really good as well and I heard the oysters were a hit at our table also.  For an entree, I went with the clam chowder and lobster roll. The clam chowder was amazing. At many places you get a couple bits of clam and maybe a few potatoes, this soup was full of clams and potatoes. The lobster roll was ordered Connecticut style and did not disappoint.   What made this dinner even more memorable was our server, Crystal. She described everything beautifully and was very attentive to our table. Honestly, she could have read off a page in the Charlotte Observer and made it sound like a 4-star meal.  We definitely need to return here!

ayqbfFHWdctPADpXtVewWg.text: This was my first visit and it won't be my last. The decor was beautiful, lots of dark wood and nice lighting. Our waiter (neglected to remember his name) was attentive without being pushy which is how some waiters can be servicing the lunch crowd. I had the pick 2 - one small plate and one side. I opted for the fried chicken steam bun with honey bbq and slaw and the Parmesan tater tots. The steam bun was well made with just the right amount of softness without it being doughy. The chicken was fried to perfection (not dry and nice crust) which was a good balance with the bun.  The Parmesan tater tots!!! Awesome. I was expecting tots with Parmesan sprinkled on but these has a Parmesan crust!  I'd go back just for those!   Overall a nice experience - I definitely want to go back and try dinner.  Nice spot for lunch without the feeling of being rushed.  Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken steam bun and Parmesan tater tots

UpHqArY_ceos6hPuA2oDzQ.text: When you leave Sea Level NC your tummy will be happy. Their oysters are DELICIOUS! I tried a few of them and have been craving more ever since. They have one of the best lobster rolls I have ever had too. It is filled with delectable lobster meat! The service is superb. They have indoor and outdoor seating available. My co-worker and I just got off the plane and were worried about our travel gear. Even though it is a nice restaurant our travel gear was fine because it is more laid back. In the downtown area next to the theater it is a great place to go before catching a show. I would definitely go back if I am ever in the area again.

Ii_M2T4Ti-vu2MiWn1PnAA.text: Awesome variety. Great oysters. Great bar menu. Great for groups for alone. Fish taco and pork belly steam bun was delicious.

FnbWTZv3b0fFh_43w_3SDw.text: I made a reservation for my girl's birthday through the Yelp app, and they called the next day to confirm. Perfect! (Sometimes I feel like those get lost in internet purgatory)We showed up 15 minutes early & were seated in Orlando's section. HE IS THE BEST! He made great recommendations & even convinced me to try mussels for the first time. DELICIOUS! He even brought out a dessert for my girl's birthday. Literally the best server we could've asked for - such a sweetheart. Plus, the food was delicious! Great service, great atmosphere. We will be back! Thanks, Orlando!

7YWlGxYhM28suMth08kXcw.text: Omg!! Loved the oyster repertoire! Lobster sandwiches were sooo laden with lobster meat I was astounded !

5hTy_yXgUYCSPaJRuwJFVg.text: Wasn't as great as I expected. I had the mussels and frites which I'd def get the mussels again, but Chick-fil-a still has better frites than this place lol! I didn't get the salmon, but ended up trying it. If you aren't a fan of fish tasting overly fishy, I'd opt for something else. Temperature was so cold that my guest and I couldn't bare it. We chose outdoor seating even though it was one of the hottest days here in Charlotte. Staff could have been more pleasant.

mMAgLiOCHq83KUfJP7sB4A.text: We had a great time visiting the restaurant. Once you come in they do have a lot of floorspace. So they are able to see more groups of people. That's one thing that we appreciate it deciding if we were going to come back with friends.  The elements gives off a quiet vibe. Almost as if you have to be real relaxed and quiet during your whole food experience. Which gives passage to how it is while you're fishing for food. You have to be calm, you don't want to scare the fish.  I chose to get the old fashion which came out very well. I also got the fish and grits I felt like that would be a basic meal for my very first visit. I must say I didn't enjoy the gravy that the shrimp and grits were made in. But overall my partner had the salmon salad which came out amazing. I wish I made that my first choice.

QFAl_QO8rtxnZKvgvlSgyg.text: Awesome cocktails and great oysters. Love this place. Service is always great here. Haven't been disappointed yet.

Bqkog489aZ-mKXQU7WKwMw.text: We came here by searching for a seafood place on Yelp. 4+ stars and we were sold since we were walking and it was close.  We ordered the Clam chowder, oysters, Salmon special and Salmon Tartar. Wow! I was blown away by the flavors and the just right amount to get me full. The kids got kids meals.  The service was great. The atmosphere was almost too fancy for bringing my three little kids. They ended up behaving well.   I was raving about this place to my family the whole night. I wanna go back when we're in town. Yes to Sea Level!

f7zb9qT3cvGjlZKm5LMPsA.text: Enjoyed a girls night at Sea Level during the Charlotte Queen's Feast. We enjoyed a 3 course meal. I had the Lobster Bisque for my appetizer, then the salmon for my main course. Enjoyed the banana pudding for dessert. Probably one of the best banana puddings I've ever had. The restaurant was very nice and even though it got busy while we were there, it never felt loud. Our waitress was very attentive. All the food was delicious!! If you're a seafood lover, this place is for you!!

4WGhi_h8v1oL0RBFeAsgjg.text: I'm a little conflicted regarding Sea Level NC.  On one hand the food is very good but I do have a significant hang up paying $21 for a single catfish filet.  That's just not right in my book.  The Good - Nice looking restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating - Service was very good.  The wait staff really know the menu. - Decent selection of booze including local beer on tap - Nice selection of oysters on the menu from multiple locations - Everyone in my party really liked their entrees - Very nice selection of seafood on the menu - Standard menu and a rotating daily menu with fresh sea food from the Carolinas - Turf items for folks in your party that want something else (burger, steak, chicken, etc.)  The WTF - Even though it was good, $21 for a single catfish filet is just nuts - Shrimp and grits was over $20.  Good but man that is high.  Note, I don't mind dropping bucks for good food and a good experience.  I do have a hang up with traditional cheap eats being slightly elevated and sold for more than double what it should be.    All that said, I would recommend but stick with the other items on the menu.

83MpCj685u7lBAKemxf_Vg.text: Love hitting up Sea Level during their Oyster Happy Hour, where their house oysters are $1 each from 4pm-7pm during the week. Outside of the happy hour, they can be slightly pricey for what they offer.  I also love items like their steam buns and lobster roll!  Would definitely recommend!

Xmo1Q8I5iIpOfGDKLvdJEA.text: I'm a oyster lover!!! So when I found out they had oysters for a dollar I ordered 3 dozen! Oysters  are fresh and delivered daily. They have oysters from North Carolina which is always a plus. They have lobster rolls and po boys I def recommend the catfish Reuben which comes on rye blackened with fryers slaw and remoulade. They also have other items besides seafood. Also try the mussels that are from Maine and are prepared in a white wine garlic butter sauces and comes with bread.  I sat at the bar and had a dark and stormy that was excellent.

TxEbucxEb0kdsPmkGup_UA.text: My wife and I went last night to Sea Level for dinner and I have to say we had a great experience. The atmosphere was chill and laid back, and our server was very attentive. We ordered our food and it arrived very fresh and hot!! The lobster roll was pretty good along with the clam chowder my wife ordered. I ordered the Carolina catfish with cole slaw and fries and it was good as well, although the catfish can use a little more seasoning. The portions were pretty reasonable as well. The price was a little high but no worries there if the experience is as good as we had ever visit. We will return again!! Thanks for the great experience Sea Level restaurant.

AFn2RgJ5dwnxJ2ZAbmB4eQ.text: Amazing menu and you can change the fried calamari to sauteed! Amazing! Our waiter Stephen rocked we will definitely be back!!!

iT2eMk2VeYoTY11hGkUBPA.text: Updating my review.  Have gone back to Sea Level for lunch and it was delicious.  Selected from the pick three lunch menu and shared with two others.  Oyster slider, shrimp steam bun, corn fritter, grits and potato cake were tasty.  Apple endive salad was very good as well.  Will definitely go back.

UqfChJG8gYmN0j1pDEP76Q.text: OK, so I'm super bummed I was so busy Snapchatting the food & talking I forgot to take still photos for my Yelp fam!! My bad! Don't let that deter you from visiting this restaurant!! Absolutely my new favorite place for seafood in Charlotte, HANDS DOWN! It was my best friend's birthday dinner & they brought his dessert with a candle in it after my unconsciously mentioning it was his birthday as were sat down. We had reservations for 8:30p on a Wednesday & it was not packed at all! We were seated immediately and our drink order was taken at the same time we ordered apps. As far as appetizers go.. all I have to say is CORN FRITTERS & TEMPURA SHRIMP!! Don't cheat yourself & miss out on those two options. I got champagne with a cranberry sugar cube in it.. forget the name of it but it has "Bubble" in the title! I drank 5 of them so don't judge my memory! My BF had the house white wine & loved it! Everything on the menu is locally sourced as it's a farm-to-fork concept restaurant! (my favorite type) So the wine was local and amazing. I had the Catfish Ruben with hand-cut fries & a side salad: AMAZE BALLS! It was like a catfish melt on garlic bread! *kisses fingers* The fries were gone before the sandwich was! My BF had the Lobster Roll & Grits which he loved, loved, loved! Everything was so fresh!! He almost ordered it again to bring home! This place is amazing. I can't wait to go again this weekend!! :)

14RSpQSB77Ttb3NmHK2G1g.text: Great place, excellent food, good service!!! Was there on a packed Saturday night. Oyster shooters were amazing and the pork belly buns as well.

Zw0Gykyt5t5WYwUbRYe0_g.text: Food was fantastic.  This was our first visit and it was a wonderful experience.   Looking forward to returning.

pWBSBdYlictLNx7hABOWZA.text: I visited Sea Level after concert at Belk Theatre on a busy Friday night. It was a late reservation (10:30) and the restaurant was fairly busy. Our waitress Mary was polite and helpful and fairly attentive. The striped sea bass, fried catfish & grits were both excellent! I will def return when I have a taste for fish and grits !

brk4uTe8MF8py-PDD31TbQ.text: Great atmosphere and friendly service. However my girlfriend and I both got food poisoning from the "house" oyster. I'd steer clear.

zH5sXD240AdxXMM3B46DwA.text: Fabulous oysters, fantastic servers, great atmosphere and I'd love to come back but honestly the home made tonic mixed with my Tito's was awful! Loved the guys working behind the bar and would encourages anyone who loves oysters to visit but bring your own tonic!

Oi0R9zGlGY3yfWW_lybgOA.text: Went before a show at Belk Theater because it was so close to the theater. Would have sat outside, but there was an obnoxiously noisy food truck serving patrons at the patio bar at Connolly's next door. We didn't have reservations so we got a small table near the front door, but it wasn't bad. Our server was friendly.  Nice wine selection.  I had the trout and a side salad. The trout was delicious. My husband had salmon and he was disappointed by the small serving. His was much smaller than my generous portion of trout. The side salad was frustrating because there were huge leaves of lettuce on a plate. The croutons and lettuce kept falling off the plate.  It's loud inside and hard to hear the server and your dinner partner.

D8UQ_2Pfk52KcjUQ6VbGCw.text: Good seafood restaurant with some creative menu options.  Oysters were good.  Duck salad was excellent.   Service was competent.  Prices were moderate to expensive depending on the choices you make.  The location is on the edge of downtown Charlote, but they have an attached parking garage and they validate.  Overall, a good option in a city not known for its culinary excellence.

Q_DyQSU0WWv9EQSZLw4jgQ.text: Seal Level gets a high 5 for ambience and location.   I am a huge seafood fan and desperately wanted to get behind this restaurant.   We started with shrimp tempura and it was meh.   The tempura batter was strong, the shrimp inside was chunky and had the right texture - it was just bland as was the sauce that came with it.   This needed some salt, an acid based sauce to cut the heavy tempura batter, some seasoning something....   the shrimp and grits was spot on, definitely on point.   I had the fried oyster slider or bun which was excellent.   Of course I had to try some oysters, which is where this place shines.    These were excellent.   I also tried the shrimp cocktail and while the portion was impressive, the rest was again unremarkable.   Again, no seasoning, nothing remarkable about the cocktail sauce, needed some punch.   With the ambience, this place has potential to be an nice downtown bar - unfortunately both my vodka based cocktails were delivered tepid.   I had do some serious table side stirring and mixing to get it where it needed to be.   It's not that difficult to shake a cocktail or even invert it.   This place was also not that busy to excuse this twice made mistake.   It's got good bones, I'd definitely give it another try but some small tweaks would easily turn a 3 into a 5.

rSDhKoxG-LFpoqRFaoV_vg.text: Definitely a cool spot, great looking space. It's almost too trendy to the point of annoying, however. Sat at the bar, service was great. Had 6 oysters, which were a little pricey in my opinion- especially for the NC varieties. They were extremely fresh and delicious though. Cocktails were very good as well, but also pricey. It seems $14 cocktails are the norm these days, even if you're not in Manhattan. Had the shrimp bun and the oyster bun, both of which were outstanding. I will be back to try some more of the interesting looking menu for sure.

z-ELJi2cV__Ha9Ck79DFfw.text: Hotel valet suggested this place and it was great! Had the sweet/spicy margarita I forgot what it's called but the little bit of ghost pepper gives it a nice kick. The shrimp appetizer yum-o!! I had the blackened salmon and it was good not great it lacked some flavor but the beet slaw it was on was o e of a kind!!!  I hear it's relatively new and it should do great here.

vzDrszIf0_d2PHbglX9A0g.text: Catfish sandwich was unreal, wine selection was very nice and oysters were delicious.

BHqMstAYtxF-R_Y5hOEQ6w.text: Had a great meal here.  They serve North Carolina seafood prepared well.  The decor is nice, servers friendly and helpful.

SvLGh_Qi4wdJgnX56Pu3Tg.text: Great bartenders! The oysters are so fresh and delicious. Charlotte needed a restaurant like this in Uptown!

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States

fOHilzu5VVkdlBDMo3WK9g.text: First time here and had a great experience! I had made my reservation for the wrong date and the hostess could not have been nicer! She spoke to the manager and on a packed Saturday night got us a great table in minutes! Our waiter Nate was awesome as well! Food was fantastic! We will be back for sure!

AyEa8qVyxXV8UPY-MUPHHg.text: My husband and I love this place! The oysters and fish were fresh and delicious.  Service was excellent. They even have my favorite wine by the glass. We will definitely be back. They validate parking, making it easy.

UV3sIPfnaQ_NvSnkU5DcaA.text: Good food, great service, and open a little later than other places in the area, but overpriced IMHO.

Z3WtnqEE7CiXX2aELsNt1A.text: Willing to give this place a second shot, as we came here for dinner before the Mumford show (on a Thurs night) and I don't think they were prepared. Our poor waiter seemed completely overwhelmed. That said.. we each ordered multiple drinks, that took 20 minutes to arrive, and once they did arrive, they were wrong and had to be sent back. The waiter was apologetic.. but it put a damper on the overall experience. The corn fritter app was just okay, nothing to write home about. I will say that the shrimp and grits appetizer was excellent. The consensus from the table (food-wise) was good, but not great. Like I said, will probably give this place another shot, as I liked the decor/vibe/location.

k0nkfu6cjB0sOCzHtJipIg.text: Having eaten here a couple times now I can 100% confirm that this place is A-OK.  On my last occasion I tried the lobster roll and was greeted by a nearly perfect example of any lobster roll I've ever tried.  The bread didn't dominate the sandwich.  This is the critical element IMO.    The service was quick and extremely friendly.  The seating and dining area was clean and pleasantly cozy.  Good date spot prior to a play uptown if you have plans for that sort of thing.

WsSWHDA4305NfJOTWf5YlQ.text: We had the corn fritters, squid chow chow, clam chowder soup, Caesar salad, calabash shrimp, lobster roll, and cast iron apple buckle for dessert! The food was really good! I felt like the lobster roll needed more butter and seasonings on it, but it was good. The shrimp was excellent! The dessert was yummy! Ohhh and I also had the fish house punch and it was soooo good! The service was great, the parking was easy, the atmosphere was fun!

AScoVhth1zGhxBMiL8k0Jg.text: Great place great experience with family.  Oyster time! 1st time and many more to come.  Went back a 2nd time and enjoyed it even more. Alexis is amazing she took care of us nicely.

yARRUG0IFWSVIK1sZmv7rg.text: We were a large group of 10 people.  Food was delicious and fresh.  I am a food snob so it would be difficult to garner 5 stars.  This place was a legit 4 star restaurant.

nxYsD97lTe21v8803GrCWw.text: Amazing food! Great atmosphere! It's my new favorite restaurant in Charlotte! The oysters are so fresh and delicious!

76qNXuBgY7o4i0tbQ3b37Q.text: We have eaten here a handful of times and the food is always delicious. However, we decided to sit at the bar the other night and it was SUCH a mistake. There were an average of 2-5 people working behind the bar the majority of the night but it might as well have been 0 because the service was horrendous. We were continuously ignored, left with empty drinks for 10 minute intervals and waited for the check for at least 15 minutes. If the bar had been packed I would have totally understood but there were only 6 people total (including us). The bartenders spent a lot of time talking in the corner, drinking personal beverages and showing us a spectacular view of their backs. I have worked in the service industry on numerous occasions through the years and was really surprised how bad this experience was.

T58Mh60uhH5d3TKJTAajSQ.text: I have now been for lunch three times and have been impressed. Fish tacos are great as is the chowder.   Service is friendly and prompt. They deliver a well prepared, modestly priced seafood lunch promptly. They understand their clientele at lunch and do a great job.   I haven't been for dinner but understand they have great oyster specials and a great beer selection.

DDybcYxCZr2j9HDCb0VhEg.text: Came for their monthly Oyster pairing for our anniversary. We waited about 5 minutes before they were ready to seat the group. Due to wanting a little intimacy, we opted for the booth for two. But we can still hear and see everything. The owner Paul welcomed us after we were seated.   He introduced us to the local guy James from Sea Level, NC. His dad was there but didnt say anything.   Paul described the restaurant as a Farm to fork concept.   Courses:  NC and Alabama (1.5-2 year growth) Piepol french white wine   Learned that oysters can be salty or sweet due to alge and other environmental situations.  Clam chouda lol as a filler  Canada (5 years old slow growth) Rose from Argentina   Seasons for oysters have changed SC is allowing summer harvesting for the 1st time this summer  NC requires refrigeration within 5hrs of harvesting  Hush puppy as a filler  (sauce was amazing)   Westport Ct  Wicked weed ale From Asheville   My bf pointed out that a tv screen runs footage from Sea Level, NC   Shrimp and grits as a filler  Massachusetts oyster Tequila shooter   Feastfood tours owner was there 5 different neighborhood tours  Maine oyster White wine from France  Suprised with a oyster shooter  Loved it!!!

C9S_Gwb5dopMcUDfuQkNXw.text: Very good. We stopped in here before a show last December. The oysters were amazing and the lobster roll and wine menu were wonderful. Great oyster too look forward to heading there again on the future.

i-cztYa1o5RR5plR_2hCWg.text: You can't go wrong with Sea Level, especially if Fin and Fino is booked for the weekend. There's a lot of reviews for SL so I'm just gonna keep mine short and sweet --  1) It's kinda dark in the restaurant, so be prepared to pull out a flashlight if you can't read your menu. However, the decor is nice and the servers welcoming! They're always going to check and make sure that your night is a good night.  2) The raw oysters are definitely cheaper here than at Fin and Fino, but there's a smaller selection. I always go for the Sea Level oysters as I like mine briny and salty rather than sweet.  3) Don't hesitate to ask for suggestions. The menu seems large but there's a lot of good stuff in it -- the lobster roll is quite tasty and the fish entrees are always perfectly cooked.  4) Save room for dessert -- and definitely share them. They're large and tasty and a good way to close out the night.

cnkxSIU_4JSY5J87I_a6iw.text: I really wanted to like Sea Level more than I did, as it has all the ingredients to be one of Charlotte's best restaurants. But on a recent visit during Queen's Feast Restaurant Week, I was only moderately impressed. While the corn fritters and clam chowder we ordered for our appetizers were both outstanding, the main courses that followed were somewhat underwhelming. I ordered the Catfish Cioppino, which was bland and somewhat sparse, while my wife enjoyed a tasty plate of Beef Short Ribs. We ended the meal with a delicious pair of Lemon Tarts, served on a flaky graham cracker crust.  (Full disclosure: my last dish of Cioppino was at San Francisco's Tadich Grill, so the bar was a little high.)  Sea Level has a cool and trendy interior with a great ambiance -- boisterous, but not so noisy that you can't have a conversation. The wine and cocktail list is extensive, and there's a solid selection of local and regional craft brews in bottles and on tap. Service was friendly and efficient, which is about as much as you can expect during Restaurant Week.   We'll definitely be giving Sea Level another chance to impress, but during Queen's Feast, the package was just OK.

CXkBnGY6VlIpHLEDDcV4mQ.text: We are from Rochester, New York. Sea Level was recommended and we are so glad we ate here! Awesome contemporary and trendy atmosphere! Fantastic drink and dinner menu. The catfish Reuben was delicious as were all of our selections. To top it all off, our server, Brittany, was outstanding!! She was friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, very attentive! We highly recommend Sea Level! You are in for a real treat!

SZ-biWsGKRp6j3GPxbqz7Q.text: Took a party of five to sea level last night for the  last night of queens feast some of us had the lobster bisque, some the oysters, some the  salmon some had the shrimp and grits some had  the brownies and some a lemon berry tart. The service was very attentive and knowledgeable the food was excellent, the atmosphere was enjoyable, and all of us agreed we will return again. I recommend it.

kTELkdlvJbF4tsmTMqk2Ag.text: My husband and I went to Sea Level last night for the first time. We got there and took a seat at the bar. We immediately noticed that tons of gnats were flying around us, which definitely turned us off. We ordered some drinks and they came quickly. I had the Meow Mule, which was delicious.   My husband ordered a few Sea Level oysters since he has never had raw oysters on the half shell. He loved them! He also ordered a burger with fries and thought they were delicious. I can attest that the fries were fresh and yummy.  I ordered the shrimp and grits and was definitely disappointed. The grits were dry and tasteless. There were tons of grits, but with them being so tasteless, it needed more gravy or sauce to make it palatable. The shrimp were small and decent, but they were a tad overcooked. The sauce was tasty, but like I said, there was not enough of it. I ate the shrimp and the sauce and left half the grits.   Overall, I'd definitely like to go back and try the lobster roll, but I will not be getting the shrimp and grits again.

ySYlgxWuOR95KEeUq5ldVw.text: Holy Shucks...I am speechless as this was the best experience I have had in NC in years. Place was packed and we started at the bar where were could get a front row seat at the action. Our server no his new name is Master Upseller did and over the top job. He took his time explaining everything on the menu what to try first the taste how to pair and so one. We received our 2 dozen oysters and went to town. The Sauces that came with the oysters were spot on as they were fresh with that slight seawater and sand taste. Fresh I mean pick up out the ocean an open with the sand still in your toes fresh. We enjoyed that then tried the seafood paella with the Lobster tail which he recommended.  As we started eating another sever came over and asked how we enjoyed everything told us about the sliders and ceviche. Our original server came back asking how everything was and also suggested the slides and in great detail explained each of the flavors. With that said we order the sliders. While we waited for our order the floor manager stopped by and asked how things were going we smiled and said perfect. We had the seafood and pork belle sliders that had amazing full flavor on a sticky bun wow. Needless to say the place packed but everyone was working hard making it seem in perfect order with quality, cleanliness and accuracy. Even the team shucking oysters was chatting with us and telling us about the strawberry ceviche which we are going to get next time. Words can't describe how awesome this place. We are coming back next week and for Birthday I am celebrating here.

bPZ_Q92B767ZcjGMFHNO7A.text: I went here with my family (dad, sister, and grandpa) for a nice dinner out in Charlotte. It was our first time, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the music playing was a little too loud and so it was kind of hard to talk to each other at the table because we couldn't hear each other. rR9ZKt9G8ohaT59OEnWOEA.text: Was yummy everything from the oysters, calamari, lobster rolls was delicious.  Really enjoyed the meal and atmosphere even though the seating is kinda smooshed. Not much privacy for conversation. Dessert was ok. Would return if I'm in area again.

WI76qtmrv6EJ4vFzZI8uDA.text: While traveling for work I decided that I was in the mood for seafood. I asked the concierge at the hotel I was staying for a recommendation and without hesitation he suggested Sea Level NC. I'm currently doing Whole30 (60 some days in, so I've reintroduced a few things here or there, but mostly staying on program) and have some crazy dietary restrictions (No Sugar, Dairy, Gluten etc)  so I knew that I might have some trouble finding something for dinner that was compliant.   My waitress Ariel was incredible and helped me find an delicious dinner. Unfortunately, by no fault of hers, I had a small issue. Upon hearing, she headed back inside to get the manager.   The manager Andrew was quick to come over and more than made up for the inconvenience. The food here is incredible and the people are even better. If you're ever in the area and are looking for a fantastic seafood dinner, give this place a shot. If I'm ever back, it'll be first on my list of places to grab dinner.

4FLJt47y3Ux4keXUBnU1ug.text: Food: Pretty damn good. I had the side salad to start and then the catfish Rueben at the recommendation of our server. Both were tasty, but I'd note that the cheese on the Rueben was borderline a little much for me. I like cheese on everything except seafood for the most part. That said, I can get this sandwich again and definitely polish it off.  Service: super polite, super attentive and definitely knowledgeable, but a little slow due to a week day lunch rush. They were certainly apologetic so I'll let slide this time.  Atmosphere: perfect for the occasion. Biz cas work lunch. Clean, comfortable, exposed wood, not loud, not quiet.  I'd go back!

F_GqEXvGiWOsqqYdp3r6CQ.text: In town for a long weekend to visit a friend and I randomly choose Sea Level while waiting for her to meet me, seafood cravings always have me explore new restaurants when I'm traveling. I was not disappointed with the service, food and drinks!  I sat at the bar for a drink and bite to eat and ended up striking a conversation with the bartender who gave me some advice on exploring Charlotte. I tried the clam chowder which was delicious, it was cream based but was not heavy or too rich and was full of fresh clams! The lobster roll was recommended by the bartender and it was 4 stars, the fries were hot yummy and the lobster was fresh! I chose the Connecticut style and though I was pleased that the lobster was not doused in butter there was lacking a little bit of seasoning and flavor, maybe the Maine style would have had more flavor.   The drink was bourbon based but refreshing with ginger beer, I tried the peach bourbon cocktail.

fOHU9tIFuTWBK1mSVcKgEw.text: I was stoked to try a place that was seafood forward--so we went during restaurant week!  First things first, DO get a reservation (even if it's not restaurant week). This place offers a great bar, outside patio and rustic-chic inside dining!  Second, if you're looking for a quiet dining experience, do not go here. It's bustling with music and at times, you'll need to speak up or lean in for your conversations! Ok with me, I got my bop on at the table!   Drinks -- they have a great selection! Classic, bartenders choice and seasonal libations, whatever suits your fancy! I wanted bourbon, so I tried my servers choice, it was great, btw. Thanks Orlando!   Food -- outside of restaurant week, if it's your first time and you're an oyster lover--start there. Get the skinny on where they source and make your selections! You'll love them and DO use their hot sauce(s).    Last night, we tried their 3-course dinner for restaurant week and everything was lovely. Ceviche - YAS. Lobster Bisque -- YUM. Shrimp & Grits - doesn't touch Charleston, but good! Salmonnnnn -- OMG, this was by far the best salmon dish I've had in a long time!   Dessert -- this was a bummer for me. If I'm going to go all out--those calories need to be worth it. They weren't. Banana pudding and ice cream cake just didn't do it -- for myself or my husbae.   Let me know if you decide to check them out!!

qg4YdUDPClCtK2YXOQG-fQ.text: We stopped here during a recent visit to Charlotte, after reading an article that said it was one of the top 50 places to eat at.   Our waiter was great and very informative considering this was our first visit. He was knowledgeable about the menu, where the seafood is sourced from, and made great recommendations.   We ordered the chargrilled oysters. They were good, I didn't read the description on the menu very carefully so the Chicago Giardiniera threw me off on the first bite. It was good, but not sure if I would order them again. My husband wasn't a fan, but hey, everyone is entitled to their own opinions, right?   My husband ordered the catfish Ruben and some of Sea Level's own oysters. He loved both, but especially liked the oysters. He said it was some of the best he's ever had.   I ordered the paella and it was huge! Not sure how one person can finish all of it! Very good and I would order that again if we came back.

uQdYh9fjFvv_fcvm7vL05A.text: Food 4.5 Value 4 Service 5 Decor 4.5  My friends and I spent 4 days in Charlotte and enjoyed this place so much we ate here twice-- once for dinner + lunch.   For dinner, we had a lovely server named Sam. He was training another server, Jessie at the time- both were SO attentive even though the restaurant was packed. Sam did a great job explaining their menu + recommending dishes. They have a DAILY fresh menu for oysters + raw bar options--- can't get more fresh than that! From 4-7pm, their Sea Level oysters are $1 each and there's no minimum or maximum order! Can't beat that.   For dinner, we ordered a bunch of apps + 2 entrees to share:   - 10 Sea Level Oysters-- all super fresh! The fennel vinaigrette is too die for.   - Calabash Shrimp- deep fried goodness   - Watermelon salad - this was my least favorite appetizer. The pickled watermelon rind was SO overpowering- super sour. The jalapeno honeydew was also too potent. It was a flavor blast but not in a good way. This dish was the most visually appealing by far though.   - Fish taco- I have dreams about this taco. Order it. The corn + slaw compliment the blackened catfish so well.   - Shrimp bun - I didn't try this but my friend LOVED it.   - Seafood paella- it's a modern take on a traditional paella. Had a few shrimp, mussels + fish on top. There's an option to add lobster tails which in hindsight, we should have done. The paella had great flavor.   - NC King Mackerel - this was part of their daily menu. The curried cauliflower rice is the star of this dish. The mackerel itself was cooked well but lacked flavor. Literally just needed a pinch of salt + fresh cracked pepper and it would have gone a long way.    DRINKS:  - Our favorites were the Meow Mule and G&T Seasonal. The meow mule had a classic twist and included strawberry and mint flavors-- super refreshing. The G&T seasonal had watermelon, was super complex and was so beautiful.   For lunch the following day, we ordered--   - Catfish reuben- flavors were GREAT. Slaw added a nice crunch. The bread was a little soggy because of the sauce from the slaw. My only recommendation here would be to use a thicker bread.   - Lobster roll- my friend loved it. You have the option to have the lobster tossed in butter or mayo.   - Shrimp po-boy - my friend LOVED it and said the shrimp were fried well   Come here and definitely take advantage of their $1 oyster special Mon -Fri from 4-7!  This place is great for business meals, catching up with friends, or date night!

The timing was incredibly quick, almost too quick but it didn't alter the quality of the food. nOU8A4ibMgw5MIiFET4-zw.text: One of my go to's for $1 oysters before 7 pm. They have it worked out with a farm in the Blue Point area to sell exclusively to them so they call the oysters "Sea Level." They are a medium size and very mild flavor, so great for if you're just getting into oysters. I usually try to go before 7 so I can start with 6-12 and not feel too guilty.  They used to do oyster/food tastings and alcohol pairings monthly, and that was an amazing experience. Either I got removed from the list after moving away for a year, or they just stopped (hoping it's the latter). ;) They should still have local events, and I recommend them.  The food is typically tasty, as the chef tries to be inventive and does some unique flavors, which I always appreciate. I usually love the fish taco, (one time I ordered it the fish wasn't good) but I'd still recommend it.  Squid chow chow and corn fritters are pretty good.  The salads are a 4/5 - nothing crazy.  It's a pretty sea food heavy place so if people in your party aren't huge fans their options are limited, just something to note - not a bad thing.  Drinks are also good, they have some high end wines and sparklings.  Overall the staff is always terrible so do not go if you're in a hurry, they take forever. I've been outright ignored on a few occasions, but I keep coming back for HH and wine. And I just know I can't be in a hurry so it doesn't bother me as much because I already know it will be terrible so I'm not set up for failure.   Hope that helps!

PnmizkP7PFGO4b75jPdimA.text: Came to Sea Level last night for dinner. The restaurant is pretty big and is right in one of the Bank of America buildings. There's indoor parking and the restaurant will validate your pass so you don't have to pay. The layout of the restaurant is a little weird to me, but also is casual and has booths, so I can deal.  Chris was our server and we started off with a beer and the house punch. We ordered 10 house oysters before 7 getting the 1$ rate and we ordered a variety of the other fresh oysters:  2 night tides, 2 bush point, 3 Malpeque. The house oysters were actually the best considering the price,  size,  Freshness.   We also ordered the Salmon tartar, the Calamari, Fish tacos, Shrimp cocktail, Oysters noda and Connecticut lobster roll. We would recommend the salmon tartar,  the calamari,  and the lobster roll.  My personal fave was the lobster roll. I would have to have fresh oysters and a lobster roll if I came back.   We ended the dinner with the cast iron apple dessert with vanilla ice cream. That was pretty good.   Chris made the experience extremely pleasant.  There was no point during the meal where we didn't have what we needed or couldn't find Chris.  He was also very friendly.  Would hope to have him as our server again if we return.

oMI2fg_7wJZ03UHOtcz_qA.text: Local folks will know that Sea Level is arguably one of the best seafood restaurants in Charlotte. Located in uptown, this restaurant is very nice for a date night or a night out with friends. Sea Level has been ranked various times as the best seafood restaurant in Charlotte.   Cool story: The delicious seafood is provided by a family of fishermen, who live in Sea Level, North Carolina. They have years of experience and are oyster experts. The restaurant is decorated with artwork and slideshows of the town of Sea Level.   Our waiter was super accommodating and gave great suggestions. We ordered a lot of things throughout the night and he was attentive.   Now let's talk FOOD. Shrimp. Oysters. Lobster. Calamari. YUM. I tried the very popular Lobster Poboy. I got very tender, buttery lobster chunks on a soft roll. Very delicious. The risotto is also VERY delicious. I also tried the Canadian oysters and my taste buds were very happy. They'll serve the oysters with cocktail sauce, two different vinegars and lemons, over ice. They have a whole selection of oysters from different regions. I felt that a good portion of their menu is Southern/Cajun inspired, like their shrimp and grits, as well as the Poboy.  I think the oil/grease was a bit too generous on the food but nothing that made it bad. For dessert we tried the apple crumble which comes with ice cream and whipped cream. A great choice for the pastry lovers.   The bartenders at Sea Level have talent in the mixology department. Grab some calamari and drinks at the bar, very, very nice option.  Also, pregnant ladies and designated drivers rejoice: they have BOMB mock tails. For those who don't know, mocktails are essentially cocktails without the alcohol. The kitten whiskers is my favorite one, tastes like a tangy Moscow Mule.   Overall, I really enjoyed date night at Sea Level & I would definitely return.

9hUZktncEuYNLn3TjtfYJw.text: I loved my shrimp and grits! I also had oysters as appetizer, it was a little bit salty for my taste buds, but that's okay. Service was excellent.

jDA4FKnd0OYIolvfhHqdfg.text: Clam chowder and Maine lobster roll, that's a wrap.   I was wandering the streets of Charlotte on a weeknight during a business trip, looking for a seafood dinner. I'm glad I found Sea Level.   It was fairly empty, but since I was a loner, I grabbed a spot at the bar. I'm a sucker for an old fashion and they had a smoked one on the menu, so that was a quick decision. I hated it. I'm a fan of smokey drinks, but this one was odd, skip.   Now, for the food, the clam chowder had tons of clam, it was perfectly silky, creamy, and hearty. Perfect for a chilly night.   My lobster roll was pouring over with juicy chunks of lobster. I had to contain my excitement when this thing came out, I didn't want to be that weird girl at the bar just grinning and salivating. I tried to be sneaky with my photos too, but I'm sure I was busted. Oh well. My first bite was exactly how I hoped it would be, I was overwhelmed with pleasure.  I had a great meal, service was quick and friendly. I'll definitely be back when I'm in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clam chowder, delish!
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maine lobster roll, get this!

iv1aFZ7V0H3xiKiIh15iJg.text: 01/18/2019, had a reservation for 8:45pm but we came in 8:15pm. Right off the bat , the front host Leslie was very helpful and got us seated in a nice table .  Our wait person was Chris , great service from this guy . I attached our list of orders in a photo . To start , I told Chris to just choose for me 6 raw oysters . The presentation and condiments were awesome . The bloody Maria oyster jammer drinks were amazing . We had a feast . Next time , I will order the paella , looked amazing . All other personnel were very helpful and informative . When we asked questions , we promptly got our responses .  Overall , the food and experience were amazing .  Lobster bisque and lobster roll were delicious . Shrimp steam bun and oyster taco were right on point.  Definitely this place is highly recommended . If there's a 4.5 stars , I would give this place that rating . A little on the pricey side but it was worth it .

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster roll
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oyster taco
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster bisque

4jEMWafKLQLzWuqIdFSIfQ.text: For our work holiday lunch my Team decided to visit Sea Level, and I am glad we did. I made reservations easily through the Yelp app. Upon arrival we were seated immediately and greeted by a very friendly waiter who offered us water, as well as highlighting some of their top items on the Lunch Menu.  Among our group, there were a variety of entrees ordered, but the top two were the Shrimp Po Boy and the Clam Chowder. The Clam Chowder was not too creamy, not too watery, just right, with an enormous amount of some of the freshest clams I've ever had. As for the Po Boy, it was packed with fresh, lightly fried shrimp. The restaurant is inviting and the service was on point. I am looking forward to returning for some oysters, seafood tower and definitely some more Clam Chowder.

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. You pick three on the lunch menu: Fried Chicken Sandwich, Clam Chowder and Fries...heaven!
Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Po Boy with Fingerling Potatoes !

dPD3Kqf691D5bQS7mOjY9A.text: This is a great place for drinks and food. We had a n awesome server as well named PJ. The Fish Tacos, Fried Squid, Lobster Roll both ways and Fish House Punch were all phenomenal. It's definitely be a must visit whenever we're in town

photos.caption: Photo of Sea Level NC - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clam Chowder
